         "Oh, hiya Jen, great morning, huh?" she started, already sounding as if she already had two cups of coffee in her. Jen grunted in response. "Sleep well? Did you sign up for showers, yet? Hey, I'm gonna take third bed tonight, so you'll have to take mine. Oh, speaking of mine, I left a skirt out for you, since I noticed you didn't have yours yet. It might be a little big on you, but you could always fill out your belly with a pillow or something, right? Anyway, see you at breakfast!"

         So many questions, so many possible statements, and not a breath's width to express them. With that, the Big Green Pillows (sans green, heavy on the pillows) pushed by her and down the hall, knocking once on her sister's door. Jen shook her head to clear her thoughts, and stepped inside.

         No sign of Gina, which wasn't good because Jen wanted to talk to her before this insane day could begin. In all the craziness that was before her, Gina had been her guide. Now she was alone. With a skirt that was at least 3 sizes too large. No blue button-down shirt. No tie.

         So much for uniforms. she thought.
12212121222212.title: The First Morning at Umberth

choices: Sneak your wirey self away from the underwires!
122121212222122.content:
Twenty-four hours ago, Jen had been nervous to the point of nausea. She was angry with her parents, angry with her school, and most of all angry with herself for getting into the whole mess of private school. It had been pointless and petty stupidity, wearing down on her parents nerves until finally they could take it no longer.

         At first, there was denial. They wouldn't really go through with it, would they? Really send her to private school? Sure enough, the plane tickets were bought. She'd just not get on the plane, right? Wrong again- her father took her by the arm and threatened to drag her if she resisted. She did, a little. He did, a lot. Alright, she'll just not go. When she got off the plane, she'd just run away. Not really- the big plane landed on a Military airfield, and her liaison was right there waiting for her.

         Now there was a queasy feeling, to have some Army grunt take you to school in his Hummer. She had been told 'private' school, not 'Private' school- a Military Academy? She'd die of embarrassment!
         No such luck. The grunt (named John, incidentally) took her through the gates of Umberth, led her to the front door of the dormitory, and literally announced her arrival to the lady sitting in the foyer.

         And now, 24 hours later, all of those things seemed just as petty and stupid to her as the problems before. Now she was witness to the weirdest illness she had ever, or make that never, dreamed up. Now, the girls outnumbered the boys almost six to one. Now, she might see, at any given moment, a classmate literally swollen to bursting with... another classmate. Now, officially, her first day at Umberth had begun.
         She was glad, really, to see that she wasn't the only person out-of-uniform. The school wasn't huge, by any standards, but of the two-hundred or so students assembling in the courtyard outside the dining hall, a dozen or so were dressed differently. All the men had loose-fitting dark dress slacks, dark shoes, blue button-down shirt and dark tie.
         All the women wore skirts that, had they been worn low on the hips as 'outside world' style dictated and as Jen was accustomed, would be full length, or at least knee length. However, every skirt she saw was fastened up high on the girls' frame, completely covering the belly. The result was that their shirts, identical to the mens', seemed ridiculously short; their ties were likewise silly-looking. At least, she thought snidely, we're not going out in public like that.

         She was also relieved, at least for now, that none of the skirts seemed to be pushed up and out right now- nobody was 'unbirthed' as far as she could see. She stretched her neck a bit, looking around, and was horrified to find that her roommate Gen and her twin sister Ginny, the Dynamic Duo of Dumb, had spotted her and began shouting and waving her over.

         She quickly sunk back into the crowd, completely forgetting that her clothes made her rather conspicuous. Soon, the Big Green Pillows and her sister were pushing through the crowd to get to her, and the chase was on! She ducked between two guys, both of whom took no real notice of her, then around a group of girls flocked together to talk about their hair. Both of the Boobsie twins stopped at the boys to say "I'm Genvieve Ramsey,-" "-and I'm Ginger Ramsey,-" "-pleased to meet'cha!" before taking on the chase again. For a second, Jen thought she saw her other roommate Gina, but lost sight of her just as quickly.
         Fortunately for Jen, the chase was stifled completely when a woman, the same woman she had met and had asked her what sex she was, opened the doors and stepped outside. With her came a delicious aroma that wafted over the crowd like a drug, silencing and stilling them.

         "Good Morning students!" she shouted to the crowd, and about half of the students shouted back, "Good morning!" This made the built-like-a-pencil woman feign disgust and put her hands on her hips. "When a teacher or advisor says 'Good Morning' or the like, it is only polite to say it back. Now, we'll try this again. Good Morning students!"
         The response was less than enthusiastic, although Jen did hear Gen's shout rather loudly. Which meant they were close.
         "Oh for Lady's sake," the thin woman said, exasperated, "With feeling, everyone! We can stand out here all morning!" To emphasize her point, she opened the door behind her, and the smell of fresh pancakes and sausage drifted over the crowd again. Then she slammed the door firmly and, straightening her blazer a bit, lifted her chin and shouted, "Good Morning, students!!"

         That worked wonderfully. Every student shouted in unison, "Good morning!", with some students tacking on the woman's name. Jen couldn't quite make it out, but thought it sounded like 'Ms. Stick'. This was good for a quick smile, to hold back from laughing.
         'Ms. Stick' was satisfied, but did not open the doors again, as she had tempted them with. "We'll work on this again tomorrow morning, of course. Now, I would like to point out again that every student has to eat, so unbirthing in the Dining Hall is strictly forbidden. And since we are on a 'special day' schedule today, students of like years will be sitting together." This prompted a few groans from the crowd, and during that period, Jen moved again in hopes of getting away from the twins.
         Well, that failed. She turned left and saw Gen, then right to see Ginny. In one cunning move, the DDoD had pinched her into submission. The hug was affectionate and from both sides, and Jen distinctly heard a boy's voice behind her comment on how lucky she was. Because of the breasts. she thought as they pressed into her arms, continuing Between the two of them, they have enough mammary tissue to make a moo-cow. And a brain to match!

         'Ms. Stick' continued, "After our meal, we will be handing out Core Classroom Assignments. Any Elective classes available will go on a 'higher-year, higher-priority' first-come, first serve basis. Please mark which classes you would like to take, and return the attached Elective sheet to the Main Office no later than Dinner tonight. That's 7 o'clock, by the way." Then she opened the doors again, this time assisted by a thick-chested balding man who had apparently been waiting just inside the door.
         "Now, students- let's eat!"
122121212222122.title: Morning Announcements

choices: The classes were all weird and Unbirth related
The classes were normal, thank goodness!
1221212122221221.content:
The rush into the Dining Hall was overwhelming, but orderly, as odd as that sounds. People were moving quickly, and there was a hint of a mob that brought up a fear of being trampled; and the air was hot and humid, steam rising from this mass of students en masse; but there was reason to it as well, with students moving as groups through the doors.

         Which meant, of course, that Jen was stuck between Tweedle-D and Tweedle-Double-D. No, not D, certainly. Maybe F? Tweedle-Double-F? Naw, that didn't sound as good.
         "So, Jen... did you sleep good last night?" asked one of the twins as they pressed towards the Dining Hall. Jen was nearly curious enough to guess which of them was actually talking, when the twin added, "Both Gen and I ended up in a bunk."
         The other quipped, "I think that's the first time neither of us has been, you know, in someone to sleep. For a whole night, I mean. In years."
         The first nodded, "Yeah, must be 4 years since we both spent a whole night outside." Then, just as the three of them squeezed through the doors and into a cacophony of students talking loudly in the hall, "No, wait, we went camping last summer, remember?"

         Jen did her best to drone out the boobsie twins speaking, even if she couldn't escape them physically. The Dining Hall was, in a nutshell, enormous. Nine long, heavy oak tables were placed across the room, with elaborately carved staircases leading up to three-tiered balcony seating. Although she couldn't see up there, she guessed that there was probably another long table on each tier as well. At the far end of the room, on a low stage complete with deep blue curtains with gold trim with a large elaborate 'U' stenciled on, was a series of smaller tables that obviously housed the professors and staff.
         Now that she was inside, there was more elbow room, but to her chagrin Gen and Gina seemed to be following her with radar sense.
         The acoustics here were awesome, or awful, depending on situation- Jen could distinctly hear voices coming from the third tier to the left and above, and the clatter of fork on plate over near the far corner. She would love to hear what this place sounded like when it was empty. for now, she turned her attention back to the tables. On huge silver platters sparsely adorning the tables were gigantic piles of pancakes and hot steamy sausages, tickling the nostrils and making that empty spot in Jen's belly quiver.

         There was a moment, just then, when Jen suddenly imagined both Genvieve and Ginger bouncing up and down inside of her trim little belly.
         She'd seen girls swallow other girls with their hips. She'd seen the wild dance that followed, as the unbirthee struggled to get comfortable. Perhaps she was still in shock a little, but her mind had somehow managed to accept these crazy things. That the thought happened at all didn't surprise Jen nearly as much as the fact that it was her own belly she was thinking about, and that that had seemed natural. She shuddered and glanced over one shoulder.

         Yep. The two were still there. And seemingly in the same conversation as well.
         "No, no no. What about Auntie Eliza?" Gen said, shaking her head emphatically. Her 'auntie' rhymed with 'Monty', which confused Jen's somewhat hick-ish vision of "Life at the Ramsey's".
         Ginnie replied, "No, that doesn't count. She held me during the day, not that night. Totally different sitchu... sitshaway... sitchiwuhay... totally different thing." Jen shook her head, smiling.

         The good thing about the Dining Hall was that the students didn't have to crowd into seats and eat with elbows bumping against each other; this had been the worst part of her lunch experience in her previous schools.
         The bad part was that, despite all the extra room, people still tended to form tight little clusters to bump elbows against, centering on the piles of food placed on the tables. This gave students easy access to seconds, and even thirds, which was what some of the guys were already on by the time Jen got her plate and a fork to stick some sausages with.

         She sat down and dug in, and the twins sat across from her. The food was good, but not perfect. Certainly better than Cafeteria food back home. There was a flavor, almost chalky, that seemed to undertone every bite she took, but it faded and wasn't noticeable by the time she was halfway finished.
         There was no set seating arrangement that she could tell, except that upperclassmen seemed to prefer the upper tiers. Jen tried a couple of times to see if she could see Gina, and thought she heard her up above, but to no avail. Anyway, with no proper seating arrangement, Jen wondered how they were going to be able to pass out schedules.

         As it turned out, the same crappy picture they had used on her dorm-room door answered her question, when a manila-colored envelope bearing her unclassy mug was thrust into her hands. Jen looked around the room to see how others were reacting, and couldn't help but grimace in reflection at the other student's faces. She opened her envelope and produced a packet of papers. The first was a 'Mission Statement' and 'Overview'.
         Umbert College is far more than just a college, it seemed. There were students who looked scarcely over 16, all the way to 21 and 22 year-olds up up higher. It was a High School, with big chunks of University thrown in. By the time a student was done here, they would have an Associate's Degree in one field or another, as well as knowledge and well-being regarding the student's 'special challenges'.
         This last part scared Jen. She was NOT a victim of any weird disease. She already knew more than she ever wanted to about the 'special challenges' these students faces. She silently prayed that the classes she would be forced to take were at least marginally normal. She thumbed through the pages until she finally found her schedule.
1221212122221221.title: Getting on Track

12212121222212212.content:
Jen pulled her schedule from the envelope, quickly scanning down the list of classes. Modern History. Physical Education. Remedial Biology. Geometry. Economics. Literature. Normal, through and through. She let out an audible sigh of relief. Each class was an hour and a half long, a bit much for her liking, and there were four open slots that she was expected to fill with electives, each 45-minutes long. This meant a very long day. But it looked like some of her classes would be on Mondays and Wednesdays, with the others on Tuesdays and Thursdays, and just her Core classes on Friday. One of the schools she had been to before had used this kind of schedule, and it hadn’t been too hard to get used to.

         “At least something will be normal,” she mused, thinking suddenly to her fast friend, Gina. It shouldn’t have been hard to find her, with as few people that actually attended Umberth; she was still missing. Jen furrowed her brow in consternation, and was rewarded for her efforts by the young man sitting across from her looking back at her, horrified, then sticking out his tongue and taking in another mouthful of sausage.
         Freak, was all she could think, looking back at him in bewilderment.

         There was more in her packet to read, especially in the Electives category. As Ms. Zdeike (as the packet now called ‘Ms. Stick’ under her picture) had said, it was a ‘Special’ Schedule day, which meant each of the already-assigned classes would be shortened to 45-minutes apiece, leaving the remainder of the afternoon to attend the various Elective classrooms, to help decide which was right for the individual student. Fine Arts like Band, Choir, and Art; Industrial Applications like Wood and Metal Shop, Drafting, and Teacher’s Aides; there must have been twenty different electives available, which Jen found a bit odd, considering how few students there actually were.

         She didn’t have much time to get into her schedule, however, as a whistle blew near the Teacher’s Stage, and out from the doors behind came three heavily-pregnant female students, bouncing and cheering as if on a cheer squad. Among them, a little to Jen’s horror, was Gina.
         They were dressed in what looked a bit like Soccer uniforms, a dark blue numbered jersey stretched tight over their belly and the word “Umberth” in yellow across their chests. Amazingly, the material was tucked in about their waists by a knee-length skirt hanging low on their hips, also in dark blue with yellow inner-pleats. They wore kneepads, and cleated shoes, and didn’t seem at all hindered by their bulging middles. In fact, one of them began juggling a soccer ball, passing it back and forth between the other two.

         “Go Umberth!” one of the crowd shouted, and this seemed to ignite something within the heavily pregnant players, who began to cheer each other on in a fabulous display of ball-handling. What they were doing was impressive, even without the enormous middles each sported.
         “Go ‘Coots!” shouted Gina, taking on a more cheerleading role. She clapped her hands together and shouted, “Give our girls a hand, and lets pop out!” she added, which caused a roaring cheer from the cafeteria. Now only one was juggling, from head to knee to belly to feet to head, while the other started to cheer as well.

         And then she squatted low to the ground, gave an enthusiastic grunt, and as she stood slowly, another pair of feet were on the floor between her own. In one smooth slowmotion stand that took nearly a minute, the girl unbirthed her load, who in turn rolled forward and sprang up, hitting the ball with her head. She too was dressed in uniform, this one wet and yellow with dark lettering, with the same skirt. Soon, three players became six as the other girls each took their turn, with Gina going last. To Jen’s amazement, Gina leapt into the air, using the knee of one of her teammates then the stage itself as a springboard, and did the splits at the apex of her jump.
         It was obvious by the middle of the jump that her passenger was coming out head-first, and fast! The girl that Gina held was completely out of her before she hit the ground. What’s more, the girl she unbirthed was, in fact, somewhat pregnant herself. Not superbelly big, but certainly pregnant. At least five months, by a ‘normal’ scale.
         Yes, it was a little disturbing, especially since this whole crowd briefly saw their naked sex and didn’t seem to care. Especially since they were, in fact, pulling whole people out of their collective wombs. But Jen had had enough reeling. Enough revulsion. She simply accepted it for what it was.

         Disturbing.

         Finally, the last girl shouted in triumph, leapt into the air just as Gina had, and PLOP! out came a ball similar to the soccer ball the others had begun passing around again, only slightly smaller. As it fell between her legs, she inward kicked, sending it up behind her towards Gina, who caught it and shouted, “BLITZ!!” The crowd erupted, shouting it back at her and then cheering loudly.
         Jen’s head was spinning. “What in the hell was that all about?” she said aloud, sure nobody could hear her. To her surprise, the freaky guy from across the table started to reply, but was drowned out by more shouts.

         Finally, as the cheers started to die down again, Gina was heard shouting, “Only six weeks until our premiere game of the season, against the Wallabies and the Devils!” At this, the crowd dwindles, a few people booing loudly at the names of rival schools. The players agreed with the few, booing as well as turning down their thumbs.
         Wait, rival schools?! thought Jen, There’s more than one school like Umberth??
         “Yeah, too bad for them. The good news is, fellas,” she said, holding up the smaller ball, “It’s a home game!” At this, there were cheers galore. It was very weird, to see a whole crowd of students all cheering for their school. She was used to having maybe a third of her fellow classmates get enthusiastic- most simply didn’t care. Not so with Umberth, it seemed.

         As the cheers again died down some, Gina shouted once more. “There’s bad news for us, too, I’m afraid.” Again, a few jeers and boos. “Yeah, I’m sorry to say it, but the Umberth Bandicoots are down a few players! So ladies, if you have that special spirit, that love of the game, that fighting heart, come on out for tryouts this Wednesday! Fellas, come cheer on your ladies to victory!”
         And somewhere behind Jen, an offkey duet of Pillows began singing the school’s fight song, Carry You to Victory. Lucky for her eardrums, it caught on quickly and the din was drowned out by the other students.
12212121222212212.title: School Spirit

122121212222122122.content:
”Through the hills and thru the trees,
You hear the Bandicoots call!
O’er land, or air, or seas
Vic’try to one and all!

“We’ll fight to win this ball
On strong or weak and shaky knees.
And should you stumble and fall,
We’ll carry you to Vic-to-ry!

“Right here is where I want to be!
Gold and Blue will beat them all,
Other teams scatter when they see
The ‘Coots of Umberth tall!

“We’ll fight to win this ball
On strong or weak and shaky knees.
And should you stumble and fall,
We’ll carry you to Vic-to-ry!”


         Despite herself, Jen was humming the tune when she left. It made sense, really, because the students had just begun a third round of the song when she decided to get a ‘head start’ and left her table. There were a few other students leaving already, so she safely assumed this was an acceptable practice. She ducked out the door and into the bright light of morning.

         And thankfully, the DDoD hadn’t noticed her leave. Small miracles.

         She opened her envelope yet again and pulled its contents out, looking for a map. Sure enough, near the last page was a very complete one. It had yellow highlights on the rooms she would be attending. Correction, gold highlights, as they shone and reflected against the sunlight. More, the highlighted spots included what times she would be expected to be at her classes. Glancing at the enormous clock hanging by the Gym, she decided she had time to look around.

         Nestled a little ways up a north-facing valley between two rolling hills, Umberth college sported a general U-shaped design. At a quick glance, it didn’t look any different than any other private school she had ever seen, which consisted mostly of movies and television. The grass was green. The foliage well-kept. The buildings were red brick, as were the walkways between them. The dorms were in the Northwest corner of the complex, in another U-shape turned on it’s side like a backwards C. From here, she thought she could even see her window on the top floor, third from the end..
         ”Yep, definitely getting curtains.” she mused.

         That Umberth had only a single Dormatory building didn’t really upset her. The boys had one wing, the girls the other. She thought back to Ms. Zdeike the secretary from yesterday, asking her what sex she was, and if she was a hermaphrodite. Did those people even really exist? Well, considering that Unbirthing really existed, she figured anything was possible. But where would they sleep? She shook her head. She didn’t really want to know. A few of her classmates had made their way back to the dorms, it seemed. She could plainly see a couple of girls changing in their rooms. Did all the girls at Umberth have no sense of privacy? Shame?
         ”No, of course not. They’re all too busy shoving their friends up their cootchie.” she thought with a snort. She didn’t know if she’d ever get used to that kind of openness, no pun intended (though it does make a nice double-entendre). It was like a new world for her.

         An oblong, semicircular building jut into the walkway south of the dorms, spoiling the effect of a single long courtyard somewhat. This building almost didn’t seem to fit the overall scheme of the campus, being a different shape and compromising the overall look. The front doors of the building even faced towards the dorms rather than the central courtyard, unlike any of the other buildings. Then she noticed that the end buildings had a bit of a newer look to them, and realized that the History Department had probably been the northernmost building until a decade or so ago.

         To her direct left, south of the History department, was the Administrative Building, which also doubled as the Language Arts department. It was plainly marked, with big gold letters. She considered going there, demanding to speak to the Dean, what was her name? Sully? Sunray? She thumbed through her notes again. Solre, Beatrice. Dean. Fine then. She’d march in, demand to speak with Dean Solre, and explain why her being here was a terrible mistake. Maybe she could talk some sense into her parents?
         But, judging by what she’d seen in the Dining Hall, everyone ate together at Umberth, even the Secretaries. Which meant that nobody would be in the Admin building. Crap. She’d just have to go later.

         At the crook of the U, nestled gently at the end of the long courtyard was the Cafeteria, which doubled as the Fine Arts building. It made sense to take advantage of the acoustics of the place. It could easily double as a Theatre, complete with stage. There were probably classrooms beneath the terraced upper balconies, and any Cooking or Culinary Arts classes could be accomplished in the Dining Hall’s kitchen. That last thought made her a little queasy, actually. Did that mean that the food she’d be eating would be a student’s grade?

         She could plainly make out the Gymnasium off to her right, and tell-tale signs of a playing field beyond that, making the U-shape of Umberth something of a lazy lowercase ‘u’. There were a few of her classmates horsing around outside the Gym, playing something not unlike tag. If she dared look closer, it looked rather like the object of the game was to capture the opponents. By capture, of course, meant to attack them with their legs, force their heads down under their skirts, and...
         Jen turned her head so as not to see the spectacle. “No shame whatsoever.” she said, shaking her head sadly.

         North of the Gymnasium were two tall thin buildings connected at the top, with lots of glass windows and exposed steel at the corners and sticking out between the floors. It was meant to be a focal point, a flashy newer building, but the steel girders had long since rusted or been covered with moss and grime. The Business and Mathematics Department was shaped rather like an upside-down U, with a domed glass top.

         Rounding out the campus was the Science and Health Department, a combination of Chemistry and First Aid, a nurses’ office and a mad scientist’s lair. This actually made sense to Jen- one naturally led to the other. It was arranged a bit like the Dorms, save that it had it’s own little courtyard and an enormous bronze statue of a lady scientist holding up a beaker, facing towards the larger Campus courtyard.
         ”Not just a lady,” she corrected herself, “The Lady. Lady Umbert herself.”
         Jen was about to start walking towards the statue, as it intrigued her a bit, when the big clock by the Gym chimed, and a few seconds later a rush of students burst from the Cafeteria like a...

         ...like a baby bursting from his mother’s womb. "And the U-shaped campus forms the legs. The architects were twisted!” she thought, wrinkling her nose and shaking her head.
122121212222122122.title: The Lay of the Land

choices: ...was actually quite normal, except for the rare odd reference or pic.
1221212122221221221.content:
Facing a tide of oncoming students now, Jen thought it best to ride the flow. Her first class was Modern History, which was on the way back to the dorm. See? Easy work. She kept up with the crowd for a while, but eventually was overcome by the front-runners who were on their way back to their rooms. Twice, she thought she could hear her name being called. Afraid the caller might in fact be her annoying roommate or her annoying roommate’s twin sister, she ignored it. Eventually, she broke away from the mob and began her trek around to the front doors of the History Building.

         The rounded two-story building was, aside from the truly curved bricks, unimpressive. The doors were painted blue, with large panes of glass above and below the central metal frame. She had to descend two steps to get to these doors, as the whole of the building had had the appearance that it was sinking. The first floor windows almost touched the ground, and she could see inside to the spacious classrooms. The doors opened easily, well-oiled and counter-weighted so it couldn’t be slammed open or shut. This surprised her a little- if the teachers ate with the students, why didn’t they lock the Department doors?
         Armed with this knowledge, she quickly moved across the off-white faux-marble tiles, her shoes squeaking a little as she went. She stopped at the first classroom door she saw and turned the knob. As with the door to outside, it opened easily. This was awesome! If for any reason she felt like sneaking into one of these classrooms, she could just skip her meal and have that time to herself! It was amazing that these freaky unbirth-types were so trusting. She would exploit that trust, if she was able.
         Gingerly, she closed the door and practically skipped to the end of the hall, where a flight of stairs led up to the next floor. In addition, there was a door (locked, sadly) next to the staircase marked ‘To Basement’. Since the first floor was practically underground already, a basement level boggled her mind a bit. However, as her first class was supposed to be on the second floor in room 206, she ascended the staircase. Behind her, she heard loud squeaking noises and new that at least some of her classmates would be coming up behind her shortly.

         A little to her dismay, when she crested the top stair she saw two people in front of her classroom, a blonde man and a dark-haired woman, liplocked in a lusty embrace. As soon as the woman saw her, her eyes widened and she pushed the man away, whispering something to him. Then she straightened her blouse and skirt and opened the door, turning on the light behind her. The man lingered a bit, watching her go in, then spun on his heels, clicked his tongue against the roof of his mouth, and began walking the other direction. He winked at Jen as they passed each other.
         She rolled her eyes. At least she hadn’t caught them having sex, or worse, unbirthing. It was bad enough witnessing her fellow students, but the teachers? She might have to stand up and puke. And how in the heck had they gotten up here so fast? She hadn’t seen them outside, and was sure she’d seen him, at least, in the Dining Hall. It was something worth investigating.
         She followed the woman, who had taken to busy work setting up her podium. It was a bit like a director’s stand, with a little step up, and a lectern with which to hold her notes. The woman smiled as she came in, as if just noticing her. “Ahh, Rocca, Jennifer. You’ll be sitting in row 3, there near the end. It’s marked.” Jen wondered for a moment how she already knew her name, but then looked and saw that yes indeed, a copy of her picture and name was taped to one of the desks near the end. This one she grabbed, folded in half, and stuck into her pocket.
         Jennifer sat down, then pulled her notes from her envelope once more. “Mrs. Mock-Food-sell? Is that how you say your name?” she asked, reading her schedule as best as she could.
         ”’Mrs. Mott-Fodsel’. The secretary made an error when she typed that up,” said her teacher, a little annoyed. “It’s Mott. Not Mock. And the last part is ‘fyoodz-ull’. There, now you’ll never make that error again.” Her smile never broke, though it did look a little strained. There was a little pause. “You’re early.”
         Jen did not waver, “First day. Good impressions, and all that.” This caused a hmmm in her teacher, who then went back to busy work.
         Jen looked around the room a bit. The desks were really old-school, not much more than a chair with an armrest, really. The desktop, barely large enough for a sheet of paper, could fold up and then slide down next to the seat. Beneath each seat was a small metal basket attached, with a thick black and silver book inside. Out the window, Jennifer could clearly see her dorm room, and saw that Gina was there, changing into ‘normal’ clothes.
         Damn! she thought, I wanted to talk to her, too! She considered getting up and going over there, but decided not to. Besides, Gina would be done and gone long before Jen even left the building.

         Within moments, other students began to arrive. Among As soon as the last student had entered, Mrs. Mott-Fodsel turned and wrote her name on the board. Then she underlined it. Twice. With a third line under the double-t and all of Fodsel. Then she turned and said, “Mrs. Mott-Fodsel. The secretary made an error when she typed the schedules up. It’s Mott. Not Mock.” She smiled and put down her chalk, “The last part is pronounced ‘fyoodz-ull’.” She seemed to overemphasize the L, as if she was chewing on it. “There, now you’ll never make that error again.”
         A few of the students laughed. Jen groaned a little inside. Then Mrs. Mott-Fodsel clicked her tongue as her man had done, then held up the black and silver book, “Speaking of errors, this is Modern History: The Legacy of Umbert, written by my husband, Matthew Fodsel. Not Mott-Fodsel. He wanted me to make sure you knew that. Something about being a man, hairy grunts and egos and all that.” Again, a few students laughed.
         Not Jen. Up until that moment, she had convinced herself that her classes, at least, would be semi-normal. She knew now that she was doomed.
         As it turned out, the class...
1221212122221221221.title: Mrs. Mott-Fodsel

choices: Do we continue to watch this scene unfold?
Or does something even wilder happen?
12212121222212212212.content:
”We could start right now, crack open these old books and dig in,” Mrs. Mott-Fodsel said, leaning slightly on her podium, “Or we could leave the books under our desks for now, and find out what what we already know. No use repeating ourselves, right?” The students, in general, were all eyes on her, and nodding in agreement.
         Jen looked around. Only 12 students in this class, counting herself. However, she was one of only three girls in the class, an aberration because girls outnumbered boys in this school six-to-one. Why was this classroom so different? Then she looked back to the podium, and guessed.
         Mrs. Mott-Fodsel, in her infinite wisdom and power suit, had failed to recall that Mr. Fodsel (if that was who that was in the hall earlier) was unbuttoning her blouse when Jen had caught them. And apparently Mrs. Mott-Fodsel, like the Big Green Pillows, could not grasp the concept of undergarment support. Her chest, while nowhere big as the combined might of the Boobsie Twins, was still flourishing nicely. Mrs. Mott-Fodsel’s cleavage went from her podium up to her neck, and very nearly exposed her left aureole. The boys probably knew this kind of thing would happen. Of course they’d take her class!

         The teacher stood back up and walked over behind her desk, then pulled down a map of New Hampshire. “First things first. Anyone know where we are on this map?” There was a hesitation, but a few of the boys and one of the girls raised their hands. Mrs. Mott-Fodsel chose the girl without hesitation. “Puchan, Nina.” she recited, pointing to the girl. She was slight of body and rather sickly of health, with greasy brown hair and a serious overbite. “All right Nina, where are we?”
         The girl looked around, a little nervous now that all attention was on her. “We- we’re about 8 miles west of Lodge Army Station, off Highway 3. About fifteen miles south of the Canadian border.” She smiled a meek little smile. “My mom made me drive, so she could take a nap.”

         ”Well, good for your mom, then!” Mrs. Mott-Fodsel exclaimed, clapping her hands (and cleavage!) together. Every boy in the room jumped, and burst into laughter. “In fact, in 1775, American Revolutionary forces marched right through here on their way to capture Montreal. You mentioned Lodge Army Station. How many of you stopped there on the way here? Hands?”
         Every hand in the room raised. The teacher nodded at this. “Of course you did. The only road to here is from there. No other way in. No other way out. Anyone care to take a guess as to why?”

         A slightly overweight, blonde-haired guy answered, “Well, duh. We’re in a ‘bubble’. A Biohazard zone.”
         This caused Mrs. Mott-Fodsel to scowl a little. “Mr. Hart, Dan. Why didn’t we raise our hands?” She shook her head and made a note on one of her papers. “He’s correct, however. Sort of. There is no bubble over us, magical, technological, or otherwise. But we are in a Biohazard Area, which brings me to my next question: What do you know about ‘Buns Seven-Eighteen’?” There was no immediate answer, and she knew it. “Anybody? Ms. Rocca, Jennifer, do you have any idea?”

         Yikes! Put her on the spot! “Umm... we’d better take them out before 7:19, or they’ll burn?”
         Dan thought that was funny. His laughter was solo, so he added, “Heh, or someone’s family is about to get waaay bigger!” The rest of the class thought Dan was funnier, apparently. The whole room was laughing now, and Mrs. Mott-Fodsel was genuinely grinning.

         For about a second. “Mr. Hart, I will not have outbursts like that in my class! One more like that, and I’ll ask you to leave.” That said, Dan looked genuinely dejected. “And Ms. Rocca, making first impressions is important, I can agree. But you have to back it up with a second and third impression. So no, you are not correct. I’m talking about BUHNS-718, the acronym for our special problem.”

         Again, nothing but blank stares, except for Jen, who wrinkled her nose a little at the notion of being lumped in with these sickos. She was NOT diseased! Mrs. Mott-Fodsel gave an exasperated sigh. “Acronym- it means the first letters spell out the full name of... oh, for Lady’s sake! It’s bee-you-aych (because the US government can’t help but throw an ‘H’ into the mix, to spoil the obvious jokes!)-en-es seven-eighteen. It stands for Biohazard: Upper New Hampshire Supervirus. The 718 stands for the approximate time the virus was first discovered, 7:18 pm on November 13, 1964.”

         Now Mrs. Mott-Fodsel leaned again into her podium, exposing a dangerously generous amount of breast flesh. “What the book and my darling husband fail to tell you is who the first victim was. Me.”

         There was a general awe that filled the room, as every mouth dropped in unison. Mrs. Mott-Fodsel had certainly captured her classes’ attention. “It was a cold Friday evening, snowing everywhere else except the area we lived in, and there was a home Football game going on. It was the playoffs, and we were on the way to make Lodge High School history as the first year to ever win the league.
         "It actually happened about halfway through the first quarter. I was a cheerleader, and during a time-out, I was placed up into a daredevil move- my partner’s hand on my rear, one leg raised, balancing up there and cheering. I was the first person to exhibit any physical sign of what would eventually become known as BUHNS-718.”

         Nina was practically falling out of her chair, she was so interested. “What happened?” she asked, without raising her hand.
         But Mrs. Mott-Fodsel either ignored it or forgave her. “The next thing I knew, I was sitting on his shoulder. And he was tickling my insides,” she said with a grin. “Then somebody screamed. And then there was chaos.”

         ”Puh-leeze! Does she look old enough to have suffered from BUHNS back in 1964? Were you even born then?” The voice was deep, and coming from the doorway. Every head turned to see who was speaking. It was the man from earlier, the tall blonde who had been undressing/fondling Mrs. Mott-Fodsel when she’d first seen her. It was Mr. Fodsel! “I wrote the book so you’d tell the story accurately, Anne.”
         Mrs. Mott-Fodsel smiled, anger seething in her teeth. “I’d tell the story by the book if you’d have written it right, Mr. Fodsel.” She stood and scowled at him, taking a few steps toward the door. Then she half-whispered, half-hissed, “We’re doing this today? I thought we were going to skip today...” Jen leaned against her desk, straining to hear what was going on. To her amusement, so did just about everyone else in class.

         Mr. Fodsel immediately saw his wife’s cleavage, and his eyebrows rose in unison. Then, as he made a motion to his own buttons as a subtle hint to her faux paus, he said, “No, no I told them I’d show them today. It’s just the five of us. We won’t be a bother at all.”
         The teacher gave a tiny shrug, turned, and returned to her podium. Then she leaned, harder this time so her bottom seemed to jut out behind her. “Fine,” she said with another sigh. “Class, this is Mr. Fodsel, my husband and Science teacher here at Umberth. Right now he’s teaching a group of young women the finer points of Anatomy, and decided that a field trip is in order. He’ll probably do this now and then throughout the term. Ignore him, he’ll go away eventually.”

         As she spoke, Mr. Fodsel led a group of four girls, probably in their late teens or early twenties, into the room. Each took off their shoes and socks, belts and other jewelry, and put them in little drawers by the door. Mrs. Mott-Fodsel did her best to ignore them, especially when Mr. Fodsel stuck out his tongue.
         ”As I was saying, before I was rudely interrupted- there was chaos.” Mrs Mott-Fodsel said. “Within minutes, the announcer Mr. Gregg was cooing and gurgling like a baby. One of the football players was nearly killed when he became a seven-year old in the span of a single play...” As she spoke, Mr. Fodsel approached her from behind, and lifted her skirt. One of the girls followed right behind him and slid her fingers into Mrs. Mott-Fodsel easily. To her credit, Mrs. Mott-Fodsel barely blinked an eye.

         ”People were leaping from the stands to get to their cars. They swamped the already-muddy field, falling over each other to get to the parking lot. The local police fired shots in the air to keep them back, but then one of the officers fell to the ground, shrinking before our... very... eyes.” This last part was punctuated mostly because Mrs. Mott-Fodsel was, even as she spoke, being invaded by this girl. Lightning fast, the girl pushed her way into the teacher’s womb, stretching her heavily downward.
         Jen was forced to watch as this normal-looking woman was suddenly transformed into a pregnant woman large enough to hold quadruplets or more. Her belly sank lower to the ground, never touching the podium but falling behind it. As it was designed to do, most likely. The last buttons of her blouse gave up the ghost, and the next girl stepped up behind Mrs. Mott-Fodsel.

         ”It were pan-der-monium!” Mr. Fodsel said in his best hickish accent. He was enjoying this. He got some kind of sick pleasure watching her stretch out with ‘babies’. Jen then realized that in a few minutes, he’d be ‘alone’ with four teen girls, inside of his wife! What a kinky bastard!
         ”It was pandemonium!” her teacher continued, leaning heavily on her podium and bracing herself as the next girl entered in. This one went considerably slower than the first, causing a slower, more steady growth in her belly. Despite this, Mrs. Mott-Fodsel had to moan a little, as the stretching was still so incredibly fast. Already, she held inside of her womb more than her whole body weighed before! How she was still standing, Jen had no idea. “The Principal made the decision to... lock... the gates... while...”

         She had to stop, as the girl was trying to get her hips through. She began to pant a little, then wriggle her hips just enough to hear her intruder’s hips ‘pop!’ into hers. Breathing a sigh of relief, the rest of the girl soon followed. “Fuck it,” she said, more to herself than her class. Then she realized her place, and blushed a little. Now she blushes?! “Class, open your books to page 9. Ms. Puchan, you start reading aloud.” Then she turns her head to the third girl in line for entry. “Well, you coming or ain’t ya?”
12212121222212212212.title: BUHNS in the Oven

choices: The Bell Rings and Jen Leaves.
The Bell Rings and the teacher wants to talk to the Gamma-girls.
122121212222122122121.content:
Nina did as she was told, telling a tale of northern New Hampshire that spanned over 400 years in just a few short paragraphs. The French and Indian War, where many boundaries were made. A spit of land not even 15 miles across that was fought over and became part of the Colonies, jutting out into what would otherwise be Canadian territory. The marching of American Revolutionary soldiers marching from Maine through here to eventually capture Montreal. The naming of First, Second, and Third Lakes. It sounded very much like any other local history book, offering both official and familiar names for those who lived there. And Nina was diligent, adding emphasis where needed, and really pouring herself into her reading.
         In any other circumstance, it would have been a commendable performance.

         It was a little unfortunate, then, that the spectacle in front of the class so outweighed her recitation. Mrs. Mott-Fodsel, leaning against her podium and panting as quietly as she could muster, as the third of four teenage girls began to push head-first between her thighs. For it all, she hadn’t started sweating, but you could tell she was biting her lip to keep from moaning. That, after all, would be unprofessional.
         The student, a brown-haired, brown-eyed lass (or so Jen remembered, as it was the first thing to disappear) seemed to have a little problem getting both of her shoulders in at once. One would slide in, but come back out when she tried to get the other in. She was getting awfully soaked from the ordeal, both shoulders slick with clear, slimy precum. Jen found herself wondering why she hadn’t gone in hands first. It made more sense to lead your shoulders, right?
         She blinked a few times with the realization that what she had just thought, as absurd as it sounded, was sound advice and probably spot-on. That scared her a little. She was starting to think like one of them! She looked around the room, and with the exception of Nina, the rest of the class was transfixed on the spectacle at the front of the room.
         Why was this so interesting? Jen was positive they’d probably seen it a thousand times already. Nobody here at Umberth thought anything of showing off their sex, shaved, hairy, or otherwise. She’d only been here a day, and she’d already seen more exposed woman-parts than in all her years previous.
         It seemed the others already inside Mrs. Mott-Fodsel here began offering an assist at this point, as there was a low moan and a grotesque slurping sound, as they pulled student 3 inside. Mrs. Mott-Fodsel had to bend her knees and rest her belly on the step before her, taking a step down to the floor for better leverage. As she stepped down, the fourth student, a thin blonde, pushed her hands in and ducked down behind her.

         It was here that Mr. Fodsel interrupted. “In case you were wondering, I do eventually get around to unbirthing, and the whole November Night Disaster. And Mrs. Mott-Fodsel is telling the truth. She was, in fact, there that night.” One of the boys raised his hand, and Mr. Fodsel responded, as Mrs Mott-Fodsel had her eyes rolled back in her head and was trying to breathe, what with three teenage people filling her abdomen and all. “Ah, yes... Mr... well, you there. Question?”
         Mrs. Mott-Fodsel opened one eye and focused for a second, “Sharpe, Damon.” was all she said before returning to the task at hand, which was pushing against the invading breasts of student 4.
         ”Uh, yeah.” Damon said, probably the smartest thing he’d say that day, “She said she unbirthed that guys arm? I thought nobody did that until Dr. Umbert did her thing, right?”
         ”Wrong. But good question.” came Mr. Fodsel’s response, as student 4 was beginning the most difficult part of her journey inside- she was on tip-toes, trying to overcome her own center of gravity, so she could finish sliding in. Mrs. Mott-Fodsel was in no mood to respond. So her husband did for her. “You see, there are two wholly different symptoms of BUHNS. By far the most common, and inflicted upon most men and women in the area, was Strain Alpha. That’s the youthening sickness. But even at the start, Strain Betas existed, capable of relaxing their sexual organs to the point of elasticity. And putting a Strain Alpha into a Strain Beta even had the effect it has today. It stopped youthening sickness. Unfortunately, it did not repair age damage that had already occurred, and the youthening sickness started up again shortly after coming back out. So Strain Betas were, at best, only a stopgap measure. This is explained in detail in Chapter Two.”
         This meant, of course, that he entirety of 400 years of history fit into a single chapter of this thick book. More importantly, that the last 40 years or so was exciting enough to fill the rest of it. And as these books looked used, it was probably a few years shorter than that. If she wasn’t so disgusted at the sight and the sounds, Jen would be genuinely entranced. Mrs. Mott-Fodsel, now finished and resting after taking four full-grown teenaged girls into her vagina, past her cervix, and into her womb, certainly seemed entranced.
         ”When Dr. Umbert arrived with her retrovirus, it was really just an isolated flaw in Strain Beta. Applied to Alphas, they either turned into Betas, if they were female, or a new Strain, Gamma, for the boys. This is the current state of BUHNS, with...”
         ”Matt,” called the still-out-of-breath Mrs. Mott-Fodsel. He hadn’t heard, so she repeated, “Matt!” Now he was decidedly ignoring her, “Mr. Fodsel!” she shouted, her breathing a little shallow still.
         ”Yes, An- Mrs. Mott-Fodsel?” he replied, smiling at her and stroking her enormous belly.
         ”You’re skipping ahead.” she said, taking his hand in hers, lifting it off of her belly, and then letting go. “And teaching my class. Again.”
         He winced. “Sorry, hon... Mrs. Mott-Fodsel! I just get excited.”
         She flashed him the same fake smile she’d flashed Jen before. “And you need to go be with your class. I’m starting to fill up.” It was true, too- the lumps of Mrs. Mott-Fodsel’s enormous belly-sack were starting to even out, and fill up. Soon, she’d be fully in pregnancy mode. Jen wondered, just for an instant, what having a belly that crowded must feel like. Then she visibly shivered, a look of revulsion on her face.
         Mrs. Mott-Fodsel then added, “And by the way, these students here are all Gammas.”
         ”Wait, Strain Gammas? The girls, too? Wow, that’s pretty rare, actually. I’d love to...”
         Jen was curious, now. She’d been lumped in with ‘Strain Gamma’, which normally only infected boys? Well, it would make her stay a little easier, anyway. She wouldn’t be expected to open her hips and swallow anybody any time soon. It meant that she wouldn’t have to explain to the Gen why she never was ‘third bed’. Although at some point, she realized she would have to let her in on the whole secret. She couldn’t take sleeping on the floor all winter. She’d die first.

         ”Goodbye, Mr. Fodsel.” grumbled Mrs. Mott-Fodsel. “Class, say goodbye to my husband, who is about to get in- 5 minutes before the bell, so he should have waited until tomorrow when there was more time since now they’ll all have to come out, get cleaned off, and get ready for next class in just a few minutes you stupid selfish man...”
         By the time she’d gotten that far in the rant, he was already shoulder deep into her, and his students were all readily pulling him in. Damon Sharpe raised his hand again, and Mrs. Mott-Fodsel, without even opening her eyes, called out his name.
         ”Um, Mrs. Mott-Fodsel? If you were a teenager back in 64, doesn’t that make you, like sixty or something?”

         This caused Mr. Fodsel to jump a bit, and attempt to pull back out. “Shhh!” she scolded him, then wriggled her behind to get her husband a little further in. “This is one of Mr. Fodsel’s favorite subjects. We suffer from a youthening disease, right? Well, that’s part of it. Before I was treated with Dr. Umbert’s cure, I had been reduced to a three-year old. I still had my memories, most of them, anyway. But it took about 12 years of my age. And then, when I had gotten back to about 15 again, I ended up with PCS.”

         PCS? What in the heck was that? thought Jen. The other students were nodding their heads in sad wonder and agreement. They knew. But Jen was one of the Untold, right? She decided she needed to borrow a copy of this book of answers. It was important for her survival.

         Mrs. Mott-Fodsel was a sight to behold. Her straight black hair still tied up in a bun. Her blouse, now hiked up around her ribs it was so tight against her as to be almost see-through. Her belly was literally the focus of her body. It started high, close to her ribcage, and pushed out well past her arm’s reach. She was easily wide enough for two people to sit shoulder-to-shoulder, and the way her belly dipped down, Jen guessed her knees were pressed into her belly for counter-balance. It very nearly touched the ground even when she stood upright.

         And yes, it was gross. The odd lump here and there was still visible from her husband still getting settled. There were old, very old laces of red stretchmarks stitched across her belly- cocoa butter hadn’t been around much when Mrs. Mott-Fodsel had started down this journey. Her skin was so shiny it was nearing latex in color, and the veins under her skin shown through like beacons. Her bellybutton stuck out like a fat nipple, nearly as big around Jen’s thumb to the first knuckle.
         And yet, it was kinda cool. Somehow, this woman had, right before her eyes, made five people disappear! And all she had to show for it was an enormous, shiny taut pregnancy. Jen still thought it was very strange and a bit deranged, but now that she knew she wouldn’t be expected to perform it herself any time soon, she felt a little better.
         ”But like I said, we’re getting a little ahead of ourselves here. Go ahead and take the books under your desk, I’ll set more out for my next class. There isn’t much time left today, so I’m giving you the remainder of the time to get to know your fellow students. Thank you.” With that said, she slowly, painfully and ponderously crossed the distance between her podium and desk, and sat down heavily in her plush chair.
122121212222122122121.title: A Very Full Oven

choices: Look for Gina back at the dorms.
Can't find her, go to PE.
1221212122221221221211.content:
There came a moment of awkward silence that seemed to last an hour or more. Jen, as with everyone else in class, just stared at the massive abdomen of Mrs. Mott-Fodsel as it bobbed and swayed this way and that. Weirdness aside (In the back of Jen’s mind, this no longer counted as ‘weird’; in the front of her mind, the back of her mind was crazy), this was probably the most fascinating thing she’d ever seen. Her teacher’s skin was stretched out so thin as to be translucent, and she could plainly see assorted limbs randomly push against their fleshy prison. Her skin had taken on a kind of glossy, glassy darkness- only those limbs closest to the skin were visible. The tight sack that was Mrs. Mott-Fodsel’s belly held in it more than four times the weight of the rest of her body combined. In many ways, she was the appendage to her belly, not the other way around.

         Then Nina broke the silence. “Mrs. Mott-Fodsel? Have you ever had more than what you have now?”
         At first, it didn’t seem as if Mrs. Mott-Fodsel had heard her. She just stared off into space, lost in her inner bliss. Then she smiled and shook her head lazily, letting it fall loosely with her looking at Nina. “Quite a bit more, in my day. A baker’s dozen, once.” Abruptly, that lazy smile that was on her face melted and she lifted her head, pointed at Nina and wagged her finger sternly. “But I don’t recommend it. I’ve had more than a few blowouts, and it stretches the skin all out of shape.”
         Inadvertently, Jen grimaced and asked, “Blowouts? Oh, God...” She was imagining some kind of weird Aliens or Species scene, where the victim’s belly literally exploded. Guts and people, blood and umbilical cords. Her imagination just soared!
         Mrs. Mott-Fodsel acknowledged Jen with another nod. “Yeah, letting them out with a big tear in your vagina is not a pleasant experience. I’ve heard ‘normals’ tear when they give birth to regular babies. But I bet they don’t tear a foot wide!” A good number of the students laughed, namely the boys. Jen’s eyes would have popped out of her skull, if they’d been able to. The thought of any kind of tear in her privates sounded absolutely horrendous. The idea of one as big as she’d just described- unthinkable. She’d die!
         This little bit of conversation starter seemed to work, for now the class was breaking up into smaller groups and chatting, introducing themselves and whatnot. This struck Jen as a little odd- she’d figured that everyone here would know each other, seeing as they were all from the same rural area. Wouldn’t it stand to reason that these diseased, quarantined people would have grown up together? Gone to the same primary and secondary schools?
         Why is it, Jen thought, that Umberth College existed, and not Umberth High School? Why lump all the people from sixteen to 22 together?
         Sadly, these thoughts were tabled, as the distinct sound of the clock outside chimed. All at once, the students rose and began piling out of the room, and Mrs. Mott-Fodsel began stroking her enormous middle and calmly cooing, “Matt? Matt, honey! Class is over, it’s time to come out now.” This was followed by a few seconds of silence, before she added, “Yes, already. Hurry up, or you’ll make everyone late for next hour!”
         Was there some kind of psychic connection between them that allowed her to hear his thoughts? Or could he speak in there? Since she was calling him by his first name, when she had been such a stickler before on proper formal titles, and with all the other students floating around in her womb with him, Jen guessed it would have to be a psychic link. But then, why would she need to speak out loud to him?

         Then there was a sudden, sloppy sound not unlike stirring not-quite-set gelatin followed by little chunks of clear blobby semi-fluid dropping to the floor between Mrs. Mott-Fodsel’s legs. Immediately thereafter, an arm, followed immediately by another, became visible down there. Mrs. Mott-Fodsel let out a groan that was drowned out by the departure of her students, as she began the process of rebirth. Jen found herself pausing, wanting to see this motion in action. It was weird, but now that she knew she wasn’t going to have to do it herself, it was really fascinating.
         Unfortunately, the movement of the crowd prevented her from gawking. Actually, that was probably for the best, as the first girl suddenly emerged, covered in that thick viscous liquid and twitching slightly, and Jen’s stomach suddenly made a sharp right turn. She paused briefly, considering going to the bathroom to throw up, but then decided to just go with the flow until she was outside the building. Once she was out of doors, she’d figure out where to go next.

         She was met at the doors by one of the twins, she really didn’t know which one. It was nice, a little, to see one without the other. By themselves, they might actually be tolerable.
         The tall redhead, towering over most everyone else in the hallway, waved at her as they crossed paths, “Jen!” she shouted, “Gina’s looking for you!”
         Finally, some good news! “Where is she?” she replied, as she was being dragged away.
         Unfortunately the twin, whether Ginger or Genevive she didn’t know, was already being pulled down the hall. She tried to shout something, but it was drowned out completely.

         Great, Jen thought with a huff, Thanks. She stepped well out of the way of the crowd, which was dispersing anyway into the Courtyard, and pulled out her packet and checked for her next class. “Oh, great. P.E.?” Physical Education. Jen paused briefly at the foot of the pink staircase. She hadn’t noticed it before, but right there, under the stairs proper, was a door leading to some unknown place. It was interesting only in that it was also painted completely pink, including the old-looking doorknob. It was almost as if someone were trying to deliberately hide it. It even had an old-looking keyhole, as might a door from a hundred years ago. As she went to investigate, she found it warm to the touch; but alas, it was locked. Probably the boiler room, she thought.
Curiosity at least temporarily quelled, she traversed the stairs and down the hall to her room, only to find her door open. This was disconcerting- Gina had told her specifically to keep the door locked at all times. Quietly, she crept up to her own dorm room door and peered around the corner.

Inside was a girl not-much taller than Jen, with rich chestnut-brown hair in tight little spiral curls running down her back and framing her face. She wore too much makeup, as if that might improve her looks somehow. Not that she wasn’t pretty- first impressions aside, she was kind of cute, at best- but she had certainly overdone it.
She was hard at work pulling off blankets and sheets from the top bunk, standing on her tiptoes to do it. She was silent and efficient, pulling off blanket, sheet, and fitted sheet in one fell swoop.
