As with the hallways, there were dark wooden beams supporting the ceiling, and the walls were of the same white paneling. There were several dark modular couches strewn about in little clusters, surrounding three large screen TVs. Along the side walls were little niches wherein sat desks and spare writing utensils; about half of which had computers on them.
         Along the back wall was the door to the bathroom, of which Jen had to peek through. She hadn’t noticed it before, but it was the same bathroom as the one in the hall- they were connected. As described by Gen, a kitchenette area complete with barstools, full-sized fridge, and microwave jutted out from the center of the back wall. Next to this was a metal-framed, industrial-looking open-air elevator, painted dark brown to match the ceiling beams. On the far side of the room was another door, which Jen guessed led to the Men’s Dorms.
         Gen could be heard mumbling something, but Jen didn’t quite hear it. “Oh, nothing. I was trying to think of something that rhymes with Lounge.”

         Ms. Zdeike was nowhere to be found, which meant nobody was here to tell her she couldn’t use the elevator. She wheeled the chair around and through the metal gate. There were four buttons with no labels, though one of them had a faint reddish glow to it. She pushed the lowest, non-red one.
         Nothing happened. “What’s going on?” Jen asked, scratching her head.
         Her labored friend rolled her eyes. Again. “Did you close the gate?” she hissed.
         ”Oh, yeah, duh!” Jen yammered, turning to close the gate. Why do I get the feeling I’m losing braincells, here? She turned back and mashed on the bottom button, then inquired, “How are you doing? Are you still in pain?”

         The elevator lurched suddenly, nearly knocking Jen over. Gen groaned terribly. “Only when I move. Or when she does...” she grumbled, petting what looked to be an elbow under her skin. The room outside rose up around them, plunging them into a dim brown-yellow light.
         The light abruptly got brighter as they approached the next floor. Jen watched as the heavy wooden doors from the lobby came into sight, then began to panic when they continued to ascend. She rattled the cage a little, which caused a loud buzzer to sound. “Well, crap!” she whispered to herself, “Too far!” When the elevator stopped, she found herself looking at a pair of heavy wooden doors with antique doorknobs. And locks. Just like the one in the Pink hallway. “Hey Gen,” she exclaimed, “Wonder what’s down here?”
         Gen’s response sounded positively annoyed, “Is it a Nurse’s Station?”
         Jen smirked, “Dunno.”
         Gen waved her hand in dismissal, “Then I don’t care.”
         ”Alright, I get the hint.” the other grumbled. She mashed on the middle button.

         Getting outside the building was relatively simple, as there was a wheelchair ramp down one side. Crossing the courtyard proved a little more difficult, as the brick pavers were rough on the little chair-wheels. More than once, Jen had to stop and let Gen’s belly come to rest, or help her rein it in, or stop and catch her breath. There were a few people prowling about, and when they took in the sight, there was one universal face from them all- a grimace of pain. As Gen got more and more red-faced, she hissed at Jen, “This is embarrassing. Just go. I don’t care if it hurts.”
         The other shrugged, “You’re the boss.” At that, she doubled her pace, ignoring Gen’s groans and pleas. They passed the statue of Lady Umbert and through the doors to the Science and Health Building. There were, sadly, no signs or markings indicating which direction to go from there.
         ”Any ideas?” she asked her big-bellied friend.
         Gen snapped back, “Yeah, just cut me open and yank her out. I’m so uncomfy!”
         Jen was quick with a retort, “Sure, that’ll help. I’m going right.” She figured she had a 50/50 chance, though her luck hadn’t been the best today.

         They rounded a corner, and much to their mutual pleasure, came face-to-face with Ms. Bailey Shannon, the short, plump, rosey-cheeked nurse. She was sporting a traditional nurse’s hat, a white nurses apron, and a bold, round belly that jutted out from her wide frame like a torpedo. It was clear that she had someone inside her at the moment, or that she was pregnant with a half-dozen babies all lined up back-to-front.
         She whistled as she took in the sight before her. “Golly, Ginger! Already runnin’ into troubles?” she asked, stepping sideways up to the chair. “Oh, but yer’ not Ginger then, are you? You’ve got them freckles up by yer’ eyes. You must be Genevive Ramsey, then. Got a bit of belly troubles, haven’tcha?”
         ”Hey, that’s right! Pleased to meet’cha!” came the immediate response from Gen. Now it was Jen’s turn to roll her eyes. “How’d you know my name?”
         Ms. Shannon began nudging Gen carefully with one hand, and bent her knees to get her ear up close to her patients belly. “I make it a point ta’ read up on all the new students ev’ry year. And your sis was in here a lil’ while ago. Who’s ya’ got in there?” she asked, thumping a little on the crown of Ronnie’s head.
         Gen went on, sparing no excruciating detail, the entire incident with Ronnie and the bed. She was all, ‘...so I kicked her in the back of the knee, and jumped up on her, and FWOOMP! In went her head! It hurt a little, but I gritted my teeth and YUURGHed down. Got her into an Oblique, so you know, ouchie and stuff, but still...’ when Jen noticed that she had been omitting very key elements of the story. That is, she was leaving HER out of it. It was Jen’s help that got Ronnie into that Oblique, thank you very much! And if it hadn’t been for Jen trying to stop Ronnie from swiping their bed, she’d never have gotten into her first full-on unbirth in the first place. Give credit where it’s due!
         Ms. Shannon pressed her lips against Gen’s belly and murmured something softly. In response, Ronnie seemed to come alive, much to Gen’s chagrin. Nodding once, Ms. Shannon grabbed the chair and wheeled it into the nurses’ station, with Jen close behind.
         ”Awright, gerrup on the table,” she demanded, then proceeded to lift Gen’s belly with ease. The woman was strong! She guided the pained Gen up to the pillow, then quickly waddled back to between her legs. It took only a cursory examination for Nurse Shannon to begin making hmm noises, followed by tsk tsks. “Yer dry’er n’a salt lick in June, Veevie.”
         Genevive winced. “I’ve always been a little dry down there.”
         ”An’ yer’ all tore up down there, too. Ol’ Ronnie roughed you up, some?”
         ”No, she went quietly. Just like she shoulda.”
         Ms. Shannon tsked again. “Well, you’re downright parched. Niagara Falls, the Mighty Mississipp, the Atlantic Ocean.”
         ”Yeah?”
         ”The opposite of you.”

         It was at this point that Jen drew a connection between Ms. Shannon and Genevive Ramsey. While Gen’s accent was far less pronounced, they seemed to share the same, almost awkward lilt. She couldn’t place it exactly, but could tell that wherever Ms. Shannon was from, the Ramsey family was probably nearby. She pondered the accent for a few moments, until she noticed that Ms. Shannon was staring at her. Gen, too.
         Ms. Shannon repeated, “So you’ve got class to go to, then?”
         Flabbergasted, “N- no, not really... well yeah, I’ve got Phys Ed, but I kinda wanted to stay with Gen.”
         The other tsked again, “She’ll be fine. We’ll pump her up with fluids, an’ let Ronnie out in a few hours.”
         ”Pump her up?”
         ”Put a hose up in dere, and fill her on up with water. That’ll do her up nicely.”
         Jen turned to Gen, “But I thought, your Auntie...that ’Sugar, it just don’t work’ stuff?”
          Gen shrugged. “Even Auntie is wrong sometimes.”

         As Ms. Shannon began putting together the equipment needed to ‘pump up’ Gen, she noted, “I never got yer’ name, Miss...”
         Jen cocked her head a little to the side, “My name is Jennifer Rocca. Didn’t you just say you read all...”
         ”Rocca, Rocca... OH! Yer’ the late-comer! You were the last person admitted this term... I didn’t even get your file until last night. I haven’t had a chance to read it yet.”
         Wait, she had a file? Here? What could possibly be on it? “I didn’t even know if I was coming here until just a few days ago.”
         The nurse chuckled, ”Ahh, I see. Well, Jennifer Rocca- you’d best be gettin’ off to class then, while I go scrounge up a length of hose for Veevie here.”

         ”SCROUNGE!” shouted Gen, startling everyone.
         ”What?!” reacted Jen.
         ”What’re you gettin’ on about?” replied Ms. Shannon.
         ”You gotta’ go Scrounge in the Lounge for a Hose so my belly Grows!” exclaimed a triumphant Gen.
         ”What’s all this, then?” asked a bewildered Ms. Shannon.

It’s nice to see that the Big Green Pillows hasn’t lost her touch for random stupid.
122121212222122122121111221.title: Lounge

1221212122221221221211112212.content:
Jen took the time to wash the blood off of her hands before leaving the Nurse’s Office. She felt good. There’d been an emergency, she had reacted well, did exactly what she felt she should have done, and now her friend would be fine. Yep, she’d be just fine.
         It wasn’t until she was back out on the courtyard that the tremendous impact of what had just transpired actually struck. Jen had, just a few moments ago, taken part of her first unbirthing experience ever. With Jen’s assistance, Gen Ramsey had just given ‘unbirth’ to another of their classmates! And Jen had actually reached her fingers into Gen to aid in this unbirth! The image of a squirming Ronnie, Jen’s would-be attacker/host/jailer, making Gen’s belly literally roll about of its own accord... it suddenly made Jen’s guts wrench.

         Standing now in the middle of the long courtyard, under a large oak tree so common in the area, Jen suddenly felt a conundrum. Should she go left, past the big clock and into the Gym, where her classmates were probably getting changed into their gym clothes... women in various states of undress, any of whom who might at any moment spread their legs and engulf her or each other?
         Or, by contrast, she could turn right, marching straight up into the Administrative Building and Dean Solre’s office, and settle this whole matter once and for all? Jen actually stood for more than a minute contemplating this, until the big clock chimed loudly, surprising her out of her self-torment. She was late for class!

         ”Well, I’m already late,” she murmured, “I might as well go see the Dean.” And without another word, she marched off to the right, over the cobblestone steps to the tall, foreboding doors that marked the entry to the Administration/Language Arts Building. As she pushed against one of the heavy doors, there was a near-violent rush of air pulling against her, as if the building had a lower pressure inside than outside. It was, in light of her recent near-unbirth experience, a little frightening- as if the building were trying to suck her inside. She shivered, trying to shake those thoughts as she slid inside.

         Once inside the building, she found herself in a short hallway encased in glass, an atrium. At the far end, another set of doors, identical to the ones outside. She pushed against those, and found it remarkably difficult to open. However, once she had opened the door just a little bit, she was hit with a rush of warm air blasting against her. Soon, the pressure equalized, and the door swung freely. She stepped inside.
         Now in the building proper, she was met by a cavernous room, triangular in shape, with doors lining the walls to either side of her. The walls were a pleasant rosy color, with the occasional large artwork or trophy case spread about here or there. This enormous cathedral-like room (complete with rounded ceiling with a triumvirate of arches, painted to represent a night sky) seemed to stretch upward for five or six floors, which Jen knew was impossible, considering the outside of the building was only three stories tall, at most.
         Directly above her was a walkway leading all the way around the room, surrounding the focal point of the floor and an awesome sight- a giant globe chandelier, an image of the sun, shone down upon all who would enter. It was breathtaking. She stood in wonder for a few seconds, before continuing her overview of the room.

         On the ground floor directly in front of her was a triangular kiosk, wherein sat a fatigues-clad Army soldier quietly reading a book. As Jen took a few steps into the room, she noted the tight-weaved, red carpet beneath her- her footfalls made no sound. And yet for it, her three steps forward had not gone unnoticed by the guard. He quickly stood to attention and broke the silence with a clear, booming voice, “Can I help you, ma’am?”
         Jen cocked her head to the side a little, suddenly feeling very grown-up, indeed. “Yes, actually. I’m looking for the Dean’s office?”
         The guard nodded once. “Left hallway is Administration. Take the elevator to the second floor, hers is up on the walk,” he pointed, turning around to orient himself as she was, “You can’t miss it.”

         Jen was about to ask about the elevator when she caught sight of the rest of the room. The triangular-shaped room had two hallways leading off of it at the opposite angles to where she was standing. In fact, from next to the kiosk, she could just see down each one- more doors, an elevator, the occasional plant- until it bent out of sight. “Right, thanks!” she chimed, turning towards the left hallway.
         ”WAIT!” shouted the guard, his voice again reverberating up through the hall like rolling thunder. Jen froze in her tracks, partially because of the impressive display of vocal strength, but mostly because she heard a distinct ‘CLICK!’ from behind her. A sound not entirely unlike the sound of a gun being checked. She yelped despite herself, threw her arms into the air, and slowly turned around.

         The soldier was smiling, holding out a ball-point pen. “You need to sign in. We keep track of who comes in here. And who comes out.” The implications here were staggering, and Jen swallowed back her fear long enough to sign the clipboard quickly. Just as quickly, the soldier reached down to his desk and produced a stamp, which he proceeded to press against Jen’s right hand. When it receded, Jen saw a blue letter ‘U’, stylized the same as on the Umberth flag in the Dining Hall, imprinted on the back of her hand.
         ”Th-thanks,” Jen cried, suddenly not feeling very grown-up at all. She wanted to go home very badly- this was all so scary, and she was so unprepared...
         The soldier winked at her, which really didn’t help.

         She turned around again, took in a deep breath to muster her courage, and walked to the elevator. Just as the soldier had said, she found the door marked ‘Beatrice Solre, Dean’ quite easily, and she very nearly barged right in. At the last moment, she stopped and knocked instead. There was no response. She knocked again, and heard something fall from the other side of the door. She hesitated for several seconds, then knocked a third time.
         ”Oh, for Lady’s sake, piss on it anyway! Come in!” came the reply from the other side of the door. A very confusing greeting, under any circumstances! Jen grimaced, then opened the door and walked inside.

         The room was utterly clean: no dust on the picture-frames that were evenly spaced across her back wall; pens, pencils, and paper in their own spaces on her desk, all arranged in uniform alignment to show that they were Sanford American brand, No. 2 HB pencils interspersed two-by-one with BIC Scheaffer Javelin pens; a bookcase against one wall perfectly balanced by a computer desk on the opposite one; a heavy oak desk placed exactly in the center of the room with two chairs placed at exactly 45° angles to the corners; in fact, the only exception to this pristine setup was the stack of thirty or so vanilla envelopes that had slid neatly off of her desk and were now strewn about on the floor leading over to the bookcase.
         In the executive chair directly behind the large desk sat a slightly plump woman in a sharp blue suit jacket and pristine-white blouse. She looked to be in her 50s, with just a sprinkling of grey flecking about in her tawny-brown hair. Her hands were folded neatly one-above-the-other, and she was looking directly at Jennifer and smiling. “Yes, can I help you?” she asked in the same sing-song voice Jen had heard on the loudspeaker earlier.
1221212122221221221211112212.title: Going To See the Dean

choices: Admit defeat, and go to Gym
Press her luck, and face the music.
12212121222212212212111122121.content:
Jen took little time with formalities- she introduced herself, sat down, gave the short version of her history, and laid everything out plainly- she did not belong here! Once she got started, she was on a roll, explaining with ever-more enthusiasm that she was not the victim of a body-altering virus, thank you very much. She would not be participating in activities she was unprepared for and ultimately frightened over, thank you very much. And she wanted to go home, thank you. Very much thank you!
         As her speech became more and more animated, Dean Solre began to fidget with her hands, tapping against her wrist at first, then scratching against the back of her hand. At one point, she glanced, for just a second, at the pile of papers on the floor beside them, but then nodded at Jen and returned her focus. Her concerned look never once faltered, though it did seem a bit glazed. When Jen finished, there was a moment of silence, wherein neither party seemed to breathe.
         ”Well,” said Dean Solre, ending this mutual suffocation, then taking in a sharp breath, “That was certainly heart-felt. Miss Rocca, was it?”

         With everything she had to say already said, Jen’s momentum ground to a halt. It was several seconds before she realized the Dean was waiting for a response from her. “Jennifer Rocca, ma’am. Yes.”
         Dean Solre made a very deliberate and practiced nod towards the girl, smiling the whole time. “Umberth College has been blessed in the past with many talented speakers such as yourself. In our esteemed history, we’ve had not one but two professional speech-writers working for Presidents Carter and the first Bush. Your speech was inspiring, young lady. Did you practice it before you came in?”
         This took Jen a little off-guard. “N-not really, no. I sorta winged it.”
         The Dean gave another calculated nod, “Impressive. You seemed very relaxed, very natural. How do you feel now?”
         Without even thinking, Jen replied, “Terrified.” Immediately afterward, she was surprised she’d said it.
         Now the elderly Dean reached out and adjusted one of her pens a minuscule amount, righting an invisible wrong in her mind. “You should consider taking Speech classes. I think you’d do well on that path.”

         Jen opened her mouth, then closed it in confusion at the woman before her. “Aren’t you listening?” she said, her voice raising just a tiny amount. “I don’t belong here!”
         The other chuckled once, another calculated gesture, before returning her hands to one-over-the-other. “Umberth College has a long, vibrant history full of success stories. We aren’t the biggest College, not even among our clientele, but I’d like to think we’re the most prestigious. Every person who comes through these halls comes out ahead, Miss Rocca. Everyone.”
         ”No, that’s just it- I’m not ‘among your clientele’!” Jen snapped, mocking the Dean’s lilting voice. “I’m one of the Untold!”
         The Dean’s eye twitched, just once. “Of course you’re not. You wouldn’t even know what that meant if you were.” She said it with a matter-of-fact smile in her voice, before continuing, “Umberth College has successfully molded thousands of young minds into productive adults within our society...”
         ”I’m not part of your society!” interjected Jen.

         Dean Solre balled a fist and pounded her desk, sending pencils and pens flying this way and that. Her whole body shook, her face turning a deep crimson. “You are! If you weren’t, you wouldn’t have made it through the screening process!” she hissed through clenched teeth. She looked like a boiler ready to explode.
         Then, with a simple exhale, she relaxed back into the middle-aged, harmless lady once again. “Umberth College has strict guidelines and policies that are followed to the letter, as required by the government. There is simply no way you could be here by accident. Now, do you have something worthwhile to ask me, or are you finished wasting my time?”
         Jen had pressed herself just about as far into her seat as was possible. “No, but you don’t understand,” she began, “My parents didn’t pay for me until just a few days ago. The Nurse, whats-her-name, Shannon something... no, Ms. Shannon, she said my file had been really rushed. There had to have been a mistake...”
         The other leaned forward, both hands on her desk, nearly to a standing position. “We do not make mistakes. We make successes! Any more of this, and I’ll put you in... confinement.” she whispered, every word measured with a viper’s tongue. “Now, if you’ll excuse me,” she said with just as much malice, “I have a room to straighten.” Even as she said it, she was lining up her pencils and pens again. Pencil. Pencil. Pen. Pencil. Pencil. Pen.

         So that was it. Her witless, stupid parents had gotten her into a mess of trouble, and they wouldn’t help her out. The Dean of the College was so unfalteringly loyal to the school that she wouldn’t accept her pleas. And with grim realization, Jen saw that any future attempts to disobey or ‘bad-seed’ her way out of the school would end with her being unbirthed. It was inevitable.

         She was stuck.
12212121222212212212111122121.title: Accepted and Rejected

choices: Does she tell him the truth?
122121212222122122121111221211.content:
Despite her initial, gut feeling to turn and run, Jen lingered for just a moment longer before turning and gracefully walking out the door. The hairs on the back of her neck stood on end as she turned away from the psycho lady she now called Dean- who knew what she was capable of?
         ”Have a wonderful first day of classes, Miss Rocca!” she heard the lady call from behind her. In her mind, the voice was so close to her she could practically feel the breath on her neck. She wanted to scream and run. Instead, she calmly let herself out, closing the door as she slipped past it. And then, she very nearly cried.

         What had gotten into her? She’d gone in, made a passionate plea without holdups or falters. She had carefully and tactfully spoken, and she actually felt a little pride in what she’d done. She’d never felt that confident before. And then, just as quickly, she’d had her hopes and prayers dashed about the rocks, her will trampled. She’d gone in as a lion, and skulked out a kitten. What had she gotten herself into?
         As she stepped out into the hallway, the globe chandelier came into plain sight, and she slowed to a halt. In the center of the chandelier, invisible from the first floor, was a blue glass figure suspended inside the globe. It was made of blown glass to look to be a full-grown woman in a fetal position. Jen stared at it through the chandelier tiers, realizing that the stylized figure appeared pregnant, and a glowing red light was emanating from her swollen midsection. It was an image of life-within-life. And then, as she stepped closer to the edge of the walkway and got a clear view of the first floor, she gasped. This room, this enormous hall that rose up from a triangle to a dome, with walkways to either side and an atrium, two-phase exit, was like a giant womb. It was life-within-life, within-life! This room was a tribute to unbirth!

         Jen’s throat started to burn, her eyes squinting through the pain, as the world seemed to crash down around her. Jen raced to the elevator, then raced for the door, not even bothering to stop for the guard at the kiosk. He looked up briefly, clicked his pen, and checked off her name with a slight grin on his face. Jen pushed hard against the inner doors of the atrium, and rode the rushing air as it carried her through. When she got to the front doors, she pushed again with her full momentum working for her.

         The door didn’t budge.
         She cried out in horror, pounding on the door with both fists and throwing herself into it with all her might, but the door simply would not open. She felt woozy, frightened, panicked, and very trapped. Crying openly now, her body in full fight-or-flight mode, her heart pounding in her chest so strong she could hear it in her ears, she thought she might go insane.
         And she might have, had she not accidentally gotten a glimpse of the sign on the door she was pounding on. Clearly marked, it read ‘Pull’.

         The absurdity of it! The hilarity! She choked on her sobs interspersed with laughter as she came to a grinding halt. She took a single step back from the door, reached out, and very gently pulled. She laughed as the door opened easily, a rush of cool September air splashing her tear-streaked cheeks. She was free. She stepped out into the day, with the full realization of it. She was free. She couldn’t be kicked out for misbehaving. She’d actually made friends easily and on the first day. Aside from the cultural differences, Umberth College wasn’t really much different from other private finishing schools. If she treated her stay here like a... like studying abroad, she could handle the differences. Yes, even the very peculiar ones.
         After a few moments composing herself, Jen Rocca wiped the tears from her eyes and off her face, stuck her chin up just a scosh, and walked to Gym- taking in the sights as might a tourist.

         It quickly became apparent that the whole of the class was behind the Gymnasium proper, down in a little natural valley, wherein a gigantic hexagonal grass field as long as a football field lay. It wasn’t a proper hexagon, really- more of a triangle with the ends cut off. Each of the three short sides, about 30 yards across (27 meters) had a goal set up very much like a soccer goal at the midpoint. The longer sides had rows of bleachers, with one side dominated by a covered grandstand. Perpendicular from the goal across the field to the opposite side, there were lines at the midpoint and first quarter, marking an inverted triangular shape in the middle of the field, with similar triangular shapes trisecting the longer sides. This was, more-or-less, an ideal setup for a game of three-way soccer, which Jen now realized was probably Blitz in a nutshell.
         There were students lined up on either side of the nearest goal, kicking around soccer balls and what looked a bit like a black volleyball. As Jen got closer, she could see that the smaller balls had the inverse markings of a regular soccer ball- black where white should have been, white where black usually was. The whole look was outlined in a bright yellow, making the ball all at once easy and difficult to see. At night, under the big lights, Jen could see how the yellow outlines would be useful. There was a man standing between the two groups of students with a whistle in his mouth and a clipboard in his hand. It was the same fellow she’d seen come out of the Dining Hall that morning. This must be Coach Guest. And as Jen made this realization, the Coach caught sight of her.
         Coach Guest was a balding man, with his hair cut crew-style and a clean-shaven face. He wasn’t a tall man, but he was broad in the shoulders and lean, with well-defined muscles. He looked every bit the drill sergeant. He wore a tight, deep blue t-shirt with printed ‘GO UMBERTH COOTS!’ across the chest and the word COACH across the back, all in gold.

         ”So nice of you to join us,” bellowed the man, the whistle never leaving his lips. This, of course, made the whistle sound with every sharp exhale, making his words sound more like, ‘(tweet)-oh ny-(tweet) of you (tweet)-oo (tweet)-oin uh-(tweet)!” Then, he spat it out, letting it fall to the end of it’s tether around his neck. He glanced down at his clipboard.
         ”You must be Rocca, Jennifer. Three laps, Rocca! One for being late, one for not dressing down, and one more because everyone does one lap!” Then he lifted his whistle back to his lips, blowing it soundly, followed by, “Lets move it!”

         As large as the field looked from a distance, it was nothing compared to how big it felt after the second lap around. She took her time, pacing herself so she could spend optimum time checking out her surroundings without having to worry about getting into the drills her classmates were being subjected to. They all looked pretty much like standard fare soccer drills- ball handling, trapping and controlling. that sort of thing. It wasn’t until she started her third lap that Jen realized there were no men on the field, save Coach Guest. She could see them now, over by the Gym, playing a game of hoops.
         The ladies on the field had begun kicking and blocking drills, doing whatever they needed to put themselves in the ball’s way, even if both types of ball came their way. In most cases, when a larger ball and smaller ball were both kicked at the same person, the person would do more to stop the smaller ball than the larger. Some of them seemed only marginally interested in what they were doing, but most were working up a sweat, trying to outclass the others, as if they were competing against each other.

         When Jen headed down the long stretch opposite where Coach Guest was standing on her third lap, one of the smaller balls escaped the crowd and bounced to a stop close to where Jen was headed. She huffed at the ball, took a running start and kicked it for all her worth. It sailed down the field, just over the heads of a few of the girls at the side-field, barely spinning at all, and whizzed past Coach Guest into the far goal, more than 70 yards (63 meters) away. Almost instantly, the whistle blew.
         ”Who kicked that?!” shouted the Coach down the field. The girls between him and Jen all pointed and parted so he could see her. “Give her another one. Rocca, do that again!” A few seconds later, another of the smaller balls was headed for Jen. She backed up, then ran onto the field and toe-punched the ball. It sailed like a rocket, about five feet above the ground, directly at Coach Guest’s head. He ducked, and it smashed into the net with enough force to make the ropes sing- and could be heard by Jen, even from that far away.
         Coach Guest spun around to see what she’d done, then shouted, “Give her a soccer ball! Cartwright, come at this goal! Rocca, pass it to Cartwright!” His commands were short, loud, and clear. As the soccer ball, a normal one this time, rolled out in front of her, she calculated. It took but an instant before she kicked the ball high into the air. It sailed lazily, loftily, as everyone on the field stood and watched, until it seemed to disappear under the late morning sun. Cartwright, a blonde girl with short, tight curls in her hair, ran while looking up over her shoulder, picking up the pace there at the end. Then she tucked her chin, rolled her head, and leapt forward, heading the ball just as it fell in front of her. It whizzed towards the goal, catching it high on the right side. Another goal.

         Jen had been good at soccer as a child, out on the playground and such. For a time, it was all she could think about. But, when her family had started moving around a lot when she was 11 and thereafter, she hadn’t had a chance to do much with it. She had, actually, tried out and made the school team in 10th grade, but she’d been forced to move once more just before her first game.
         Now, she was becoming a bit of a celebrity. The other girls cheered her on, and Coach Guest was positively beaming. She could hear them asking who she was, and before she even got over to the Coach, she’d heard people referring to her as the ‘Rocca Rocket’. It was nothing, really. The little ball, the ‘Blitz’ as it was called, was so light she could smash it with ease across the field.
         ”Congratulations, Rocca. You just made the team!” shouted Coach Guest, making a note on his clipboard. A few of the other girls groaned, but most seemed happy for her. Then the Coach added, taking her in his arm and walking her towards the goal, “So, what’s your V-V? Two? Three?”
         Oh, great! thought Jen suddenly, More UB crap! “Vee-vee, sir?” she asked. She recalled Ms. Shannon calling Gen that name. She’d thought it was a cutesy shortening of Genevive.
         Coach Guest nearly stopped in his tracks, but instead only hesitated slightly. “V-V, yeah. Vaginal Variance. How much control do you have with your muscles down there?”
         That sickening feeling in her guts rose up again as Jen heard this. It was redoubled when she saw the blonde girl, Cartwright, inward kick the blitz ball, pulling it in under her skirt. Jen watched as her slim abdomen bulged sharply as the ball obviously entered her. Immediately thereafter, a cadre of other classmates took off after her in a run. She dodged left, then sprinted right, to get away from them. When they caught up to her, they did their best to trip her, tackle her, or get both hands on her. As soon as one person did, the blitz ball dropped out from between her legs, and all at once, her belly bump was gone.

         Coach Guest sighed. “You must be a One. No matter, we’ll get you stretched out and in shape!”
122121212222122122121111221211.title: ...and Accepted Again

choices: Catch up with Jen sometime after lunch?
1221212122221221221211112212111.content:
The field was green, and clear, and Jen felt good. She had a chance to really shine, out here. For the first time since arriving yesterday, she felt that maybe, just maybe, there was a place for her at Umberth College. Sure, it wasn’t exactly Soccer, and she wasn’t exactly qualified to stuff a blitz ball up into her, but she might be able to fake it. With a piece of elastic, she could maybe tuck the ball under her skirt, and nobody would notice, right?

         Coach Guest woke her from her thoughts, “So, what should I put down, Rocca? One or two?”
         Oh, right... thought Jen with a wince, that V-V stuff. Would he accept a Zero? Less than Zero? She sighed. “I guess I’m a One.” she replied sheepishly.
         Her new Coach clapped one hand on her shoulder, “You guess? Well, we’ll just have to find out!” That spoken, he sounded his whistle loudly, making her cover her ears. “Gather up! Fellas, that means you too!” he shouted, his voice heard remarkably well for being out of doors, until Jen realized he had used the grandstand acoustics as a sounding block. Well, that and he was, terribly, terribly loud. Within a minute, the crowd of Phys. Ed. students had gathered midfield.
         Once gathered, Coach Guest bellowed, ”Alright, this is a short day, so we’re about done here. I wanted to do some V-Drills, but that’ll have to wait until next time. Now, I hate that I only get to see you ladies three days a week, so I’ve got a little homework for you. Take a blitz with you as you leave, and try to hold it in place for at least 30 minutes tonight and every night, to strengthen your V-V. If you can, run with it, do aerobics with it... whatever you girls do. Guys, I’ll be opening up the weight room for you next time, and I’ll need some help out on the field, too.”
         Then he put his hand up in the air, slowly lowering it towards the crowd of students. “Bandicoots on three!” he shouted, and a few of the students caught on right away, putting their hands in the circle as well. “One, two, three-“
         ”Bandicoots!” came the thunderous reply, though about half the crowd didn’t join in until the ‘-coots’ part. Jen said nothing, amazed at how enthusiastic the students here were to be participating. Back in her old school, showing school spirit meant you were a cheerleader, a geek, or gay. Was it because this was a private Finishing School, or something about the people themselves?

         As the crowd dispersed to get their blitz ball from the big bag aside the field, or to the showers, Coach Guest added, “Matka, Rocca, Cartwright, and Jumeaux- practice starts at 5 o’clock. Don’t be late!” At this, he heard a few moans and grumbles. “And the rest of you, don’t worry- I’ve still got a few spots to fill yet!”
         Jen looked around for the other names he’d shouted. Cartwright she’d seen, albeit only briefly. Who were Matka and Jumeaux? She saw mostly backs of heads, as people made their way across the field. A few people continued to kick around their ball, but for the most part people seemed glad that class was over. As Jen hadn’t dressed down for class, she didn’t feel the need to go get undressed in front of everybody- so she headed for the courtyard, ball under one elbow.
         But as she studied her classmates from behind, Jen failed to notice the girl who was, in turn, staring at her from behind. She also failed to hear her approach, until the girl was practically on top of her.
         Not literally. “Uhm, excuse me? Rocket? Was that your name?” came the softspoken voice behind her. Jen turned, expecting to see a short, timid little girl. Instead, she saw a black woman with long, dark cornrows pulled back into a ponytail, piercing blue eyes, and light makeup. She looked as if she could have been pulled from the cover of a stylish magazine.
         Jen stammered, “Eh, no- no, it’s Rocca. Jen Rocca.” She blushed a little, not used to being called ‘Rocket’.
         The other woman nodded. “Non? Oh, I see- Rocca. I am Sophia Jumeaux. We are on the team together?”
         ”Oh, hey! Hiya, Sophia! Pleased to meet-“ Jen started, but tripped over herself as she realized that she’d just about blurted out the DDoD’s catchphrase. “Yeah, I guess so.”
         The supermodel-teammate nodded. “You kick very hard.”
         Jen could notice a distinct French accent, indicating that Sophie was probably French-Canadian. Would that make her African-French-Canadian? “Thanks,” was all she could say in reply.
         The other reached out and took Jen’s shoulder. “It was not a compliment. This is a game of finesse, not brute force. You have to caress the blitz, not smash it. You see?”
         Jen stopped walking to confront her. “I can handle a ball just fine, thanks.”
         Sophia snatched the blitz from under Jen’s arm, sneering, “Can you? I know your type. You probably tuck it in so deep you can’t get it out You are a One, after all. No control.”
         ”Excuse me?” shouted Jen, her face contorting with anger. “You don’t know me! You don’t know anything about me- and I don’t know anything about your bitchy little ass. Lets wait until after we’ve gotten past that before we start hatin’. Dig?” As she said the last part, she made a grab for her ball.
         Sophia continued to sneer. “Vulgar! You are not a One at all- you are less than one. You are a Zero!” This said, she dropped Jen’s blitz, inward-kicked it, and in an instant the black skinny bitch looked like a black pregnant one. “Zero control!” she added, then tensed her stomach muscles.
         A very wet, slimy blitz fell to the ground between them. Sophia spat on it, then kicked it up at Jen’s face. Jen raised her hands to catch the ball, but couldn’t get a grip on it- Sophia had slimed it good. She walked away, laughing.

         Great, thought Jen, another enemy.
1221212122221221221211112212111.title: Less Than Zero

choices: Jen can't escape—one more "bun" for the oven.
After a clever fake-out, Jen manages to make a break for it.
12212121222212212212111122121111.content:
The rest of Jen's classes that morning were more or less normal, without much trace of the unbirthing that pervaded the school apart from one or two students getting together or coming apart in the halls. Lunch was about the same as breakfast—a raucas, crowded affair where people grabbed helpings of food from the platters on the table. It was pizza, and not bad pizza at that. The faint chalky taste was still there, but Jen was hungry enough by now to ignore it.

As Jen was leaving the cafeteria, fiddling with the map to try to locate her first afternoon class, she walked right into someone standing on the sidewalk in front of her. "Oh, excuse—" She trailed off as she looked up and saw Sophia Jumeaux standing there. "Uh…hello?"

Sophia smiled sardonically at her. In her peripheral vision, Jen noticed other members of the Blitz team moving in to surround her. Deep inside, Jen felt herself beginning to panic. Where was a teacher when you needed one?

"Bonjour, 'Rocket,'" Sophia said. "We have been asking around about you. As I suspected, it seems you are what they call a 'normie,' one of the Untold, except that someone has told you by now—not yet one of us at all. This is not a surprise—some like you are admitted every year. What is strange is that no one has noticed yet. Coach Guest should have been able to tell."

"Uh, yeah. Congratulations. You've learned my secret. Can I go now?"

Sophia raised a hand. "Non, not yet. Hear me out. Since it would be a shame for our team to lose such a powerful kicker, I am going to help you out."

"I thought you preferred finesse," Jen said.

Sophia shrugged. "Perhaps I misspoke. Brute force has its place, too. But the point is, I can give you finesse."

Jen wasn't sure she liked the way this seemed to be going. "Oh yeah? How's that?"

"Simplicity itself. I can infect you with BUNHS." She smiled. "Actually, anybody can. You simply have to spend at least 48 consecutive hours in the, shall we say, company of a friend. And then you will be one of us, and we will then see what your V-V is."

"I see," Jen said slowly. "But let's just say, for the sake of argument, that I don't want BUNHS…or at least, don't want to get it from you?"

Sophia's smile broadened. "You seem to be under the mistaken impression that I am giving you a choice."
12212121222212212212111122121111.title: An Offer She Can't Refuse

choices: Sophia was straight about her intentions to give Jen BUNHS and nothing else.
Sophia has ulterior motives for unbirthing Jen.
122121212222122122121111221211111.content:
Sophia gestured to her teammates. "Girls…strip her." Before Jen could move, her arms and legs had been grabbed by half a dozen Blitz players, who held her in place no matter how she tried to struggle. Others pulled off her blouse, her skirt, her socks, her panties.

"Help! Teachers, students, anyMMPH!" One of the girls stuffed Jen's own panties in her mouth. Then she was stark naked, and the girls forced her to kneel.

Sophia strode forward, letting her skirt fall to the ground and stepping out of it without missing a step. Even half-nude, with her clitoris winking in the light, she still looked nothing but stylish. How did she manage that?

Jen spat the gag out. "No! I don't want to go in there! You can't make me!" She started struggling again, but there was nothing for it with that many people holding her.

Sophia smiled at her, and knelt down in front of her. "Oh, poor thing. You have been clinging to this last shred of normality, haven't you? Trying to convince yourself that you can get through this school without ever spending time inside another 'student body,' that you can be with us but not have to be one of us. But c'est impossible. If not me, it would have been someone else sooner or later, who might not be as nice as me. One way or another, the uninfected never last long at this school."

She got back to her feet again, and snapped her fingers. The girls holding Jen shoved her forward, pushing her head right into Sophia's genitals. Jen squirmed and thrashed, almost managing to break free with one last adrenalin surge, but the girls piled onto her and held her, and shoved her forward, while others braced Sophia from behind. With a wet SLURP, she went into Sophia like a battering ram into peanut butter. In just a few seconds, it was over. Sophia patted her bulging tummy and stepped back to pull her skirt back on.

Inside Sophia's womb, Jen whimpered to herself. The size and shape of the enclosure drew her up into a fetal position, naturally, and the warm fluid supported and caressed her. That sting of pain she felt at her waist must have been the umbilical cord attaching, so she would be all right without breathing. She tugged at it experimentally, but it was firmly anchored. "But I don't wanna be in here," she murmured. But it was becoming more and more clear that she didn't have a choice.

Back in the outer world: "But Sophia—how are you going to get away with this?" one of the girls asked. "You'll have to let her out at meals—"

"Not if she doesn't show," Sophia said. "Watch and learn." She placed her hands to either side of the bulge in her chest, and took a deep breath—and the bulge started to contract. Inside, Jen whimpered as she felt herself starting to shrink. Her chest flattened. Her body shortened. Her fingers grew short and pudgy.

Sophia stopped when her chest was perfectly flat. "Gosh," one of the other Blitzers murmured. "Did you unpregnate?"

Sophia snorted. "What use would I have for bigger breasts? To have to buy all my bras all over again? Non. You do not have to unpregnate to hide them. Only make them young enough. Little Jen is now three years old inside of me."

"But won't she interfere with carrying the ball?"

Sophia smiled. "She is in the very back of me. I have a V-V of 4. The ball will fit with room to spare." She tossed her head. "Enough. To your classes. I will see you at practice." She turned and walked away, and the others dispersed in other directions.
122121212222122122121111221211111.title: Jen Enters Sophia

choices: Jen looks for and finds Gina.
1221212122221221221211112212111111.content:
Jen thrashed about inside Sophia. She desperately hoped this would cause discomfort so her captor would birth her to end the pain. However, all Sophia did when Jen thrashed was giggle. This puzzled Jen at first but then she realized the amniotic fluid must cause the thrashing to feel like dull movements.
Therefore, Jen merely curled up in a fetal position and sulked. She continued to do this as she felt Sophia eat, sleep and attend class. However, after what seemed like forever, Jen was turned on her head then began heading towards the closed cervix. After several minutes, she burst through the cervix and her head entered the vagina. A push came from behind and pushed Jen all the way out and onto the floor.
Jen quickly stood up to look at Sophia. In her sulking, Jen hadn't noticed Sophia had returned her to her original age. Thus, she was surprised when they were able to look eye to eye. "Um . . ." said Jen.
"A thank you would be appreciated," said Sophia.
Jen thought Sophia sounded as snobbish as the day she'd been shoved in and wanted to reply with a stinging retort. However, she said, "Thank you."
"You're welcome," said Sophia. She then walked away.
1221212122221221221211112212111111.title: In and Out

choices: Sophia lets Jen out next year
Sophia holds Jen for somewhat longer
1221212122221221221211112212111112.content:
Jen drifted in the warm fluid of Sophia's womb. It was actually quite restful, relaxing. She was beginning to see what the other girls liked so much about being inside of someone else. But still, she couldn't forget that she had been placed in here unwillingly—she was Sophia's prisoner until such time as Sophia wanted to let her out. It was degrading.

She could hear sounds from the outside world every so often, when she felt like listening. Right now, she was hearing Sophia's conversation with Coach Guest. "No, actually, I have not seen Jennifer Rocca, Coach. Perhaps she changed her mind about the team. Or perhaps she ended up inside of someone else. You know it happens to some every semester."

"Damn. She was a powerful kicker, too. All right, then, let's get out on the field..."

Hold on...if she was giving me BUHNS so she could put me on the team, wouldn't she have told Coach so? Something wasn't right about this...not right at all.

Out of spite, Jen tried to shove the blitz ball back out whenever Sophia carried it, but her short stubby body couldn't quite reach the ball where it was being held at the front of Sophia's womb from where she was placed in the back.

Later on, she heard Sophia talking with the other girls. "So when are you going to let her out?" one of them was asking.

"I'm not sure what you mean," Sophia said. "I let her out yesterday, can't you tell?"

"Tell how? You look just as flat as after you took her," the other girl said.

"I do, don't I?" Sophia asked smugly. "I don't know what's happened to her. Maybe someone else took her." And the conversation moved on to other things.

You liar. Jen tried to kick and pound at the sides of Sophia's womb, but not much happened.

Later, when Sophia was alone, Jen heard Sophia chuckle. "I know you can hear me in there. How does it feel, to know that my body is your prison?" Not waiting for an answer (as if Jen even could answer from within her fluid bath), she continued. "Of course I'm not going to let you out. Not this year, at least." She giggled. "As if I would let my star role on the team be eclipsed by anyone else, especially a normie like you. Or perhaps I should say ex-normie by now." She giggled again. "So why don't you just go to sleep now, that's a good girl. I'll see you next year. Or maybe the year after..."

Jen felt her consciousness beginning to drift away. Fight it as she might, she couldn't stay awake, and before long the warm darkness engulfed her entirely.
1221212122221221221211112212111112.title: Imprisoned Indefinitely

12212121222212212212111122121111122.content:
The next thing Jen knew, she was being pushed out of a warm, dark place into the cold, bright light. She opened her eyes to see Sophia, blurry and out of focus, staring down at her. "Oh non! C'est vous! C'est impardonnable!

Jen rubbed her eyes. As they cleared and she was finally able to focus, she noticed a couple of things. First, she was still the shrunken three-year-old that Sophia had made of her in order to keep her concealed. Second, Sophia seemed to be older—a lot older. She'd aged well, there was no doubt about that—she seemed even more attractive than the day she had slurped Jen up. But she had to be in her late thirties or early forties now—far from high-school-aged.

Then Jen's anger overcame her shock. She glared. "What did you do to me!"

Sophia looked stricken. "Jen—it was Jen, wasn't it? I am so, so sorry! I didn't mean to do this!"

"What did you do!" Jen demanded again.

Sophia wrung her hands. "I…forgot about you. Je suis vraiment désolé—I am very sorry! I meant to keep you just until after the blitz ball season, and then let you out, but what with classes and things, you simply…slipped my mind. You were so tiny, and stuck so far back up in me, that nobody ever noticed you when I unbirthed them. I only just found out after a thorough gynecological examination."

Jen felt a chill running down her spine. "How long was I in there!"

"You must understand, I—"

"How long!

Sophia looked down. "Twenty-one years."

Jen stared. "Twenty-one…oh my God. All my friends…my family. What must my parents have thought? Are they even still alive?" She looked down at herself. "And why am I still only three years old?!"

Sophia blushed. "After so long in there…I thought it best to get you out again and not risk…damage…by changing you again. You need another BUHNS host to age you back. Anyone can do it. But I think I know where to find you one." She picked up a cell phone from a bedside table.
12212121222212212212111122121111122.title: Jen Van Winkle

12212121222212212212111122121112.content:
The next five hours went surprisingly fast for Jen, despite the fact that each class, while normal enough on paper, had a slight ‘twist’ to it. Her ‘Remedial Biology’ class was actually ‘Revised Biology’, a study of those infected with the virus and its effects on the human body. It was a hybrid Science/Health class designed to put first-year students at ease with their ‘changing bodies’. And the book had pictures. Lots of pictures. Very graphic ones.

         Very.

         Immediately after Biology was Geometry, which began with a pop quiz similar to any of the sort she’d had in High School. No reference to unbirthing at all, until the story problems. 'If Tabitha’s belly is 22 inches in circumference normally and 100.5 inches in circumference when carrying Tom, a 5’5” boy who weighs 110 pounds; what is the volume of her belly when carrying him, assuming her belly takes a perfectly spherical shape?' Jen didn’t have much hope with these problems, even without the unbirthing overtones. Seventeen thousand, one hundred and fifty-seven cubic inches? That seemed an awful much.

         Lunch was rather less formal than breakfast had been- they still had assigned tables, but students were free to come and go as they pleased. A careen filled with a rich, hearty chicken soup was on each table, and a platter heaping with fried-cheese sandwiches sat beside it. Jen sat next to Nina Puchan who, aside from congratulating Jen on making the team, remained too introverted to hold a conversation with. There was no song or dance, skit or announcement at the finale of lunch, just a gradual clearing out of the room as students left, and the clatter of plates and silverware being picked up by the Kitchen Staff.
         Jen did get to see Ginger for just a moment, as that twin was hurrying out the door with some food for her sister. Gen was still at the Nurse’s Station, but was going to be fine. She’d probably get to release Ronnie in a few hours, but would be sore for at least a couple of weeks. Yay her.
         No sign of Gina.

         After lunch came Economics, which thankfully didn’t include any sort of unbirthing at all. She wasn’t really surprised- what did these people have to offer the economy, besides a unique and bizarre disease? Unfortunately, it did include Economics, which Jen had never cared for or did well in. She’d be in over her head in no time, unless she got some help. And here, getting ‘in over your head’ could be a literal proposition.

         Finally came Literature. The required reading for the class was a reference book entitled 'Making Headway', and Jen couldn't help but laugh at the imagery. In it were pieces of American literature dating from the mid-sixties to today, with commentaries between. In the first few paragraphs, it became clear that the curriculum taught that the gradual wearing-down of social stigmas in the 60's, 70's, and 80's- commonly called the 'Sexual Revolution'- was actually a government plot to prepare the country for the reality of BUHNS. And as crazy as that sounded, it actually made some sense.

         The rest of the afternoon, she was told, was to be spent exploring 'Elective' class options. Music, Art, Creative Writing, Debate/Public Speaking, Teacher's Assistant, Student Government- all these and more qualified as electives. A student could have as many as four such classes, and much to Jen's surprise, as few as none. If she decided not to take any electives, she'd have several hours to herself each day. After some thought, however, the idea of roaming around the campus unattended each day, with other students capable of making you 'disappear' at a moment's notice... no, she'd try to fill up all available space when possible and stay with a group if she could, thank you very much. She had a few friends already, and maybe she could find a way to stick around them. Safety in numbers, after all.
         The first elective wasn’t hard to decide- she wanted to take choir. It wasn’t that she was particularly good at singing- she thought her voice was a little tinny, and she always had trouble projecting- she just enjoyed it. And, she figured it was the least likely class to involve unbirthing in any shape or form. An hour to be normal- that appealed to her.
         She was only a little surprised to find out that she had to audition for the class. No problem- she had done a solo for competition her freshman year of high school, and was pretty confident she could still remember it. It surprised her a little more when she heard the petite little brunette that auditioned before her. It wasn’t that she was particularly good or bad- what surprised her was that the girl had a decidedly baritone voice. The girl did a sultry, even sexy, country song that stirred up feelings deep in Jen’s gut that she didn’t expect at all.
         If she closed her eyes, she could imagine a hunky guy with a cowboy hat on belting out the lyrics. But when she opened them, there was only this little brunette. It wasn’t masculine, in the sense that it wasn’t gruff or dominating- rather, it had the sensitivity of a feminine voice, only much deeper. Jen’s mind was having all kinds of confused and conflicting thoughts. It was unnerving.
         What was more unnerving was that afterwards the brunette, when she heard Jen sing, cheered her on and seemed genuinely excited at Jen’s talent- similar to Coach Guest’s enthusiasm when she was out on the Blitz field. Jen had this gnawing gut feeling that somehow, in some way, this couldn’t end well. Somehow, it would be twisted into something Umberth-worthy.

         The brunette introduced herself as Bernni Dunn, and Jen was relieved to hear that when she wasn’t singing, Bernni had a much more feminine lilt in her voice. The two of them chatted for a bit as they walked out to the courtyard.
         “So, what made you decide on Umberth?” Bernni asked as she flipped her hair up over one shoulder, exposing no fewer than seven earrings in her left ear.
         “Didn’t have much choice,” Jen replied, as if she’d been Bernni’s friend for months already, “My parents are making me come here.”
         Bernni nodded emphatically, “Me too! My mom said it was here or else! It totally sucks!” Then she added, “But you know, family history, I guess. My mom went here, back in the day. She says she met me here, too.”
          “Met you?” Jen asked nervously.
         “Yeah,” Bernni replied, “I guess I used to be my mom’s boyfriend.” There was an awkward pause, then Bernni added, “I know- weird, huh?”

         For her part, Jen didn’t bat an eyelash. “No more than usual around here.” Ahh, there was the Umberth twist she was waiting for.
12212121222212212212111122121112.title: The Rest of the Afternoon

choices: Continue with the girls in their dorm.
122121212222122122121111221211122.content:
Bernni walked across the courtyard to the Admin/Language Arts Building, as she said she wanted to take an elective there. Jen, remembering her encounter with the Dean earlier, wanted to stay away from that building as much as possible. Jen found herself watching as Bernni sauntered into the building, her eyes transfixed on the other girl as she went. It wasn't until after she had disappeared that Jen realized she'd been staring at Bernni's butt. It was firm, but big, not at all like the boys she usually goggled at. Round, more like an inverted-heart shape. And yet, Bernni's swagger was not unlike the boy's- a far cry from how a girl should walk. Very distracting.
         ”What the heck?!” she shuddered aloud and scolded herself- where in the world was this coming from? Bernni was a girl, for crying out loud! Sure, she used to be a boy, once upon a time, but... Jen's nose turned up in confusion and disgust, and she shook the conflicting thoughts from her head.

         When Jen turned around again, she ran into Gina. Well, actually... Gina ran into her- literally. She had seen her roommate and decided to sneak up on her. Jen hadn't taken two steps into her room before Gina locked the door behind them. Before the sound of the latch had even finished, Gina remarked, "You've made a terrible mistake, Jen."
         At first, Jen thought the comment was funny, so she laughed while looking out the window. Only Gina wasn't laughing. In fact, Jen suddenly became aware of the cold silence of the room, and the prickly sensation on the back of her neck told her that Gina was standing directly behind her. She shivered, reminded of the chill of the night before. "Gina," she said with a gulp, "Gina, that isn't funny."
         Despite already knowing where her roommate was, Jen still jumped when Gina grabbed her shoulder and spun her around. Gina was so close that she could feel her breath, feel the heat of her body just inches from her, contrasted by the cold void that was the window behind. "No," said Gina, "it isn't."
         "Gi… gina?" Jen's voice cracked, her eyes twin saucers.

         Where the courage came from was anyone's guess, but Jen surprised Gina. She reached out and pushed her roommate back to arm's length, and scowled at her. “That's not up to you. Coach Guest thinks I can.”
         Gina snorted, “Yeah, he does. He thinks you have everything you need to be a great player. But he's wrong, Jen. You don't.”
         Jen pushed her away, “We'll see.”
Gina stood, a little shocked and a little impressed. “Okay, we'll see. Think fast- you're in the other teams' Contested Zone, and the Blitz comes sailing towards you. The goal you're facing is defending against the other ball, but I'm open at the center-line. What do you do?”
          Jen blinked, then shook her head, “Contested Zone? Uh, since the goal is guarded, I look to the other goal, then pass it to you?”
         Gina raised her arms over her head, “Tweet! Foul! Sorry, the Blitz must always move down-field or laterally while in your possession. You just got a penalty.”
         Jen huffed, “I didn't know that. Now I do. Big deal.”
         Gina continued, “Think fast- you're dribbling the ball downfield, when the Blitz comes sailing your way. What do you do?”
         Looking a little frustrated, Jen replied, “I don't know. Are they worth different points or something?”
         ”Tweet! Foul!” shouted Gina, “Until the ball currently in your possession has been touched by someone else, you are not eligible to touch the other ball. Penalty.”
         ”That's not fair!” argued Jen, “You didn't give me a chance to tell you my answer!”
         ”And I told you to think fast. So think fast- you just kicked the Blitz halfway down the field, and nobody is even close to it- they're all busy with the other ball somewhere else on the field. What do you do?”
         ”This one's easy- I kick it towards the other goal, since everyone else is busy on one end.” Jen seemed happy with the answer.
         ”Tweet! Foul!” shouted Gina, putting her hands on her hips, “No player may touch the Blitz more than once without it first coming into contact with another player. Another player must touch it first. Penalty!”
         Jen shook her head, “That's stupid!”
         Gina shrugged, “That's the rules!”
         Jen shook her head again, “Okay, so I don't know all the rules. No big deal- how hard can they be?”

         ”You don't know the worst part, Jen,” stated Gina flatly, “When you get a penalty, you must spend time in the Penalty Box. And do you know where the Penalty Box is?” The cool, evil tone to which Gina said this last part sent shivers down Jen's spine. Or maybe that was just the cold air from the window?
         ”I don't,” she replied, “but I'm sure you're going to tell me.”
         Gina lifted a leg suddenly, putting her foot on the top bunk. At the same time, she lifted up her skirt, revealing that Gina, as before, did not seem to own any underwear. In a flash of skintone and moistness, Gina's netherworks opened up like a giant, toothless maw revealing a dark, dangerous abyss big enough to drag a full-sized person into... whatever was in there. “Right here, Jen! Any one of your teammates except the Keeper can be the Penalty Box. You have approximately 30 seconds to get in, or we get a point!”
         Jen stared with saucer-sized eyes, trying hard not to swallow. Then she scrunched up her face in consternation, “Wait, we get a point? Isn't that a good thing?”
         Gina sighed, “The team with the lowest score at the end of the game wins- defending your own goal is more important than scoring, though that is important, too. You now have fifteen seconds.”
         Jen looked up, “Oh, I get it- 'cuz there are three teams, it can be hard to tell who makes the goal against you, so they tally up goals lost instead of goals scored. That makes sense.”

         Gina smiled at her, “We go. We do what we have to. We survive because we can. Unlike you, we don't get to choose not to go into the Penalty Box.”
         Another long pause, Jen relented, “Coach Guest isn't going to be happy.”
         Gina shrugged, “Coach isn't really happy right now anyway. We lost three starters last year.”
         Jen replied immediately with, “Purple Cord?”
         Gina looked startled, and her face betrayed that she was a little offended, “No, you jerk,” then she chuckled, a smirk on her face, “They graduated. Not everyone leaves here as a horror story. PCS is rare.”

To his credit, Coach Guest only cried a little. "Why are you doing this to me?" he begged, watching his dreams of a winning season diminishing before him. They were standing in front of his office door, just outside of the locker rooms. Behind them was a display case, sadly lacking in trophies. Sure, there were a few, but they were from years, even decades, ago. He reached out and touched the case, knowing that he was unlikely to add to it again this year.
         "Coach... c',mon," replied Gina, "It's not like it's her fault she's a Gamma."

         He placed both hands on her shoulders, looking down at her. "I already turned in the roster- and I got reprimanded for being so late with it. Not my fault Umberth opens two weeks later than the other schools in the league. They've been breathing down my neck all last week."
         She reached up and grabbed his shoulders in return, causing his arms to fall to his sides, "So, you call them back and tell them there's a mistake?"
         There was an intimacy in their touch that gnawed at the back of Jen's mind. The people of Umberth College had a strange sense of personal space. It was uncomfortable for Jen to be next to someone, let alone in a virtual hug. Everyone here was so touchy-feely!

         He sighed again, pulling away and stepping away for a moment, as if considering. Then he turned on his heels, "It was literally a last-minute thing today. They're printing the rosters as we speak." He shrugged, then pointed to Jen, "I have a prize Wing, and I can't even use her."
         Jen pouted, her back against the wall, "Isn't there anything I can do?"
         Coach Guest met her gaze for the first time since they'd come with this news, "Everyone on the field has to be able to play the penalty box..." he explained.
         Gina looked over her shoulder to Jen, then quickly back to Coach Guest, "...except for the Keeper! The Keeper can't be the 'box!" She was smiling, as the thought had just occurred to her and she thought it was brilliant.
         He waved the thought away like swatting at a fly, "We have a Keeper already. And that would be a waste of her talents. No, she's on the roster as a Wing."

         Jen had had enough- she pushed herself off the wall and took a stance. "Look, I'll practice with you. I'll go to the games. Can't you put me on... Injured Reserve or something?"
         Coach Guest stared at her for a few seconds, then blinked abruptly and nodded. "For now. But we can't play you. What's the point?"
         "So, I'll be... a manager then? Ball-girl? Statistician? I just wanna be involved!" In her head, she added, As long as I'm with Gina, she can protect me!

         He sighed once more, a long, defeated sigh. "Fine. Tendo, show Rocca her locker and get her practice uniform. She's number 21."
         The two girls squealed, "Thank you Coach! You won't regret this!"
         He wiped a tear from his eye, "I already regret this..."

info.brief_description: Welcome to Umberth College. Climb on in!  Now with UB, bellies, and fun!
info.description:
Synopsis: Umberth College is a place for unbirthing. In 1964, there was a terrible plague that swept through a tiny portion of northern New Hampshire and southern Quebec. It created a need for Umberth College, and made unbirthing possible. The people there now live with a secret they are forbidden to divulge to the world outside.

It is now modern-day, and Umberth is about to begin!

**RULES**
1.) No Vore! The eating, absorbing, and/or digesting of students, faculty, friends, enemies, or relatives is strictly forbidden. For those who believe UB to be a form of vore, digestion and absorption are not allowed. There are dozens of interactives around with vore- go there if you must have it. I will change, destroy, or delete entries with vore content at my own discretion.
2.) This story attempts to be a semi-believable diversion from reality, and talking fox-people, dragons, and other anthro-yiffo-morphological creatures have no real place here. Ghosts, disembodied minds, and magic are not wanted here. Any creature/person that isn't human will be treated like a monster. It doesn't have to be hard science, but keep it in the realm of pseudo-reality.
3.) Sexual situations are allowed, as long as the storyline supports it. For the sake of this story, all characters in this Interactive Story are works of fiction portrayed by fictitious actors who are over the age of 18. Any resemblance to persons, places, ideas, or intellectual properties is purely coincidental and is not meant as a challenge on those properties, ideas, places or persons.
4.) Don't post things like, "The main character sees this guy so she unbirths him" and leave it at that. Post with substance! One-liners are best left in children's books, where they have pictures to express details instead. Make a paragraph (three lines minimum). Make it mean something.
5.) Above all, have fun!

I reserve the right to delete or edit posts that violate the above rules. I will edit posts for spelling and grammar, when I catch it. I will also add punctuation, indentations, and the like to make the page more 'conventional'. Don't think of it as offensive- I just want to see every thread get the respect it deserves.
Again, have fun!
-symbiote01
**ADDENDUM 6/15/11**
I have put up a copy of my notes and examinations of the various topics and ideas in this story here(http://www.writing.com/main/view_item/item_id/1785537-Notes-for-Umberth-College). You are NOT required to use them, look at them, or otherwise acknowledge them in any way- they are simply there to give a glimpse into how my brain dissects the story and makes it acceptable for me. That said, feel free to use any information found to your liking.
